characters: A CHYRON SCROLLS UP THE SCREEN
NANCY PUNCHES ALEX ACROSS THE JAW
THE BOTTOM OF THE BIRD STAND
A69 ON AN ELECTRONICS STORE BAG
BOOK IS DUE ON WEDNESDAY AND I'VE
BEHIND A ROW OF BOOKS AD218
ANCHORS AND STOOLS TO PAY FOR
WRITTEN THREE PAGES IN THE LAST SIX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA SWINGS AROUND and slowly moves toward... (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 10/11/06 3rd Pink Revision 4.

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR
dialogues.text: --and at least four rooms of their own. A place they can call home. The camera stops on a unique looking BROOKLYN BROWNSTONE.

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: That’s their first mistake. TITLE: “Duplex.”

dialogues.speaker: KENNETH
dialogues.text: When I told you I had a particular building [etc.]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Real Estate Agent KENNETH, 40s, raspy voice, friendly demeanor opens the back door, leading in a young couple, NANCY and ALEX.

dialogues.speaker: KENNETH
dialogues.text: Butler’s pantry, the old dumbwaiter... Alex WHISPERS in Nancy’s ear.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Remember what we talked about.

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: I know. Poker face. She nods, ‘I got it,’ and they move into...

dialogues.speaker: THE KITCHEN/PANTRY AREA 4
dialogues.text: Kenneth points out various features, not pushing too hard letting the place sell itself.

dialogues.speaker: KENNETH
dialogues.text: Built-ins, built-ins...

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: Kitchen’s a little small. She glances over to Alex who flashes a quick thumbs-up. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 10/11/06 3rd Pink Revision 5.

dialogues.speaker: KENNETH
dialogues.text: Get rid of this awful divider, you have an eat-in kitchen. Cozy fireplace there. A tiny-squeal escapes from Nancy. Alex mock-admonishes he with an eyebrow. KENNETH (CONT’D) Original glass tiles in all the fireplaces.

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: Fireplace-es?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A CARESSING PAN of the second fireplace, ornate woodwork, wainscotting, gadrooning, etc.

dialogues.speaker: KENNETH, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Three. This one’s tiger-eye maple. Notice the details, the wainscotting, gadrooning, all original...

dialogues.speaker: ON ALEX AND NANCY
dialogues.text: She's falling in love.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: (mouthing) Gadrooning?

dialogues.speaker: KENNETH
dialogues.text: And over here you have your library. Kenneth gestures to an alcove of bookshelves.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Wow. Nancy playfully motions for him to play it cool.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (explaining to Kenneth) I have a small collection of first edition novels. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 10/11/06 3rd Pink Revision 6.

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: Alex is a writer.

dialogues.speaker: KENNETH
dialogues.text: Oh, yeah. What kind of stuff?

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: I wrote a novel you’ve probably never heard of. “Crying in the Sprinkler” (Kenneth shrugs, doesn’t know it) It’s kind of a loosely fictionalized memoir of my childhood.

dialogues.speaker: KENNETH
dialogues.text: I’m not much for the coming of age stuff. I love thrillers. Grisham, Koontz. They scare the crap out of me, but it’s like I’m addicted to “Goose Bumps.” Let’s move on.

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: Peacocks, lover!

dialogues.speaker: PARLOR/LIVING ROOM 6
dialogues.text: The living room is a sight to behold. Huge. Light floodin in. A curved front window area looks out onto the tree-li street. Nancy digs her fingers into Alex’s arm.

dialogues.speaker: NANCY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh my god. Alex tries his best to act the level-headed buyer as he notices... yet another hearth.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: I see, so there is a third fireplace here in the living room.

dialogues.speaker: KENNETH
dialogues.text: And over there, you’ve got a little outcropping, you could make it into anything you want... (to Alex) -..a writer’s nook... (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 10/11/06 3rd Pink Revision 7.

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: A writer's nook! How perfect is that? (off Alex’s look) I mean, if you like nooks. Nearby, Alex notices something.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Is this a staircase? He points to a SPIRAL STAIRCASE camouflaged behind severa plants. Kenneth walks over.

dialogues.speaker: KENNETH
dialogues.text: Yeah. Oh, I thought you realized. This is a duplex.

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: (can’t contain herself) A duplex?! As in two floors for the price of one!

dialogues.speaker: KENNETH
dialogues.text: It’s right there on the listing sheet. Alex looks at the sheet in his hand. Sees it in tiny prin

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Why’s it sealed off? Were there a slew of murders up there?

dialogues.speaker: KENNETH
dialogues.text: No, it’s a massage parlor. Alex and Nancy are stunned. KENNETH (CONT’D) I’m just making fun. There's a sweet old lady who lives upstairs...

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: (not thrilled) A tenant?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they climb the stairs, Nancy caresses the bannisters. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 10/11/06 3rd Pink Revision 8.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Rent-controlled means we can’t kick her out, right?

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: Alex!

dialogues.speaker: KENNETH
dialogues.text: It’s a legitimate question. You can’t evict her. She has to decide to leave or...god forbid... poor thing hasn't been feeling well. She must be a hundred years old. Kenneth shakes his head, Nancy and Alex joining him. Now the landing, he knocks loudly on the door.

dialogues.speaker: KENNETH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Mrs. Connelly? (to Alex and Nancy) She's hard of hearing. It may take her a little while to get to the door. (louder) Mrs. Connelly?! SFX: Many locks being opened. Alex, Nancy and Kenneth wait, exchanging polite looks. Finally, the door creaks open.

dialogues.speaker: BEHIND THE DOOR
dialogues.text: Peering out, is MRS. CONNELLY. She’s a tiny, frail lady i housecoat -- with her unblinking expression and lack of m up, at the moment, she resembles a corpse. Her face flashes in recognition. She smiles sweetly and speaks with a slight Irish brogue.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. CONNELLY
dialogues.text: Kenneth!

dialogues.speaker: KENNETH
dialogues.text: There’s my favorite girl! How are you feeling today, Mrs. Connelly?

dialogues.speaker: MRS. CONNELLY
dialogues.text: I don’t feel good, Kenneth. Nancy peeks over Kenneth’s shoulder into the apartment. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 10/11/06 3rd Pink Revision 9.

dialogues.speaker: KENNETH
dialogues.text: I’m sorry to hear that. I’ve brought by a young couple, who might want to buy the apartment. Kenneth steps back to reveal Nancy on tip-toe; she drops quickly and interlocks arms with Alex.

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: Good afternoon, Mrs. Connelly! I’m Nancy Kendricks, and this is my husband, Alex Rose.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Hello.

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: Do you mind if we look around?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Mrs. Connelly speaks, Nancy’s gaze drifts over her hea She sees only a sliver of the apartment.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. CONNELLY
dialogues.text: Sorry, dear. I don’t feel up to it. Nice to see you again, Kenneth. The door CLOSES on Nancy’s face. We hear the door slowly being LOCKED again. Then, we hear Mrs. Connelly coughing, followed by a tiny squeak of sickly despair.

dialogues.speaker: KENNETH
dialogues.text: Poor dear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex and Nancy stand on the sidewalk with Kenneth.

dialogues.speaker: KENNETH
dialogues.text: I‘1l tell you right now, there’s a lot of heat on this place. (lowers his voice) It’s gonna be off the market by Monday. Adios. Kenneth walks away. Alex And Nancy look around, at: A YOUNG COUPLE walking along, in love. A MOTHER, pushing a baby carriage. CHILDREN, laughing in the playground across the street. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Al0 10/11/06 3rd Pink Revision 10. IN THE SECOND STORY WINDOW -- Mrs. Connelly sits in a cha staring blankly out the window. As she coughs...

dialogues.speaker: OMITTED 9
dialogues.text: INT. NANCY AND ALEX'S EAST VILLAGE STUDIO - NIGHT Al10 It’s one room, tidy but crowded. Street noise filters in. In a cheap IKEA bookshelf, there are several FIRST EDITIO of various classic novels. Nancy, Alex, Coop and Celine finish their dinner served o dining room table a bit too large for the main studio roo

dialogues.speaker: COOP
dialogues.text: Three fireplaces! Guys, this place sounds incredible.

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: It is incredible! And, surprisingly, kind of affordable.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Well, kind of affordable. It’s really at the higher end of our range.

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: It’s a little more than we wanted to spend, but when you factor in the duplex...

dialogues.speaker: CELINE
dialogues.text: It’s a duplex?

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Well it’s not exactly two ...yet...There’s an old lady who lives on the second...

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: .--floor, but she’s...I mean she’s older...Old. And her health is...

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: I mean it’s Brooklyn, we weren't even thinking of Brooklyn... From the street, we hear a DRUNK DUDE yelling at a SQUEAK VOICED TOUGH GUY. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 10/11/06 3rd Pink Revision 11.

dialogues.speaker: DRUNK DUDE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: I’m gonna kill the shit out of you.

dialogues.speaker: SQUEAKY-VOICED TOUGH GUY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Say that to my face, ass-bag. Say that to my freakin’ face.

dialogues.speaker: DRUNK DUDE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: I just said it to your face! Coop looks to Alex, acknowledging the exchange outside.

dialogues.speaker: COOP
dialogues.text: Hey Alex, sometimes you just have to “close your eyes and leap off the precipice, unmoved by the daunting growls of the rabid dog named fear”.

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: Wow. Who said that?

dialogues.speaker: COOP
dialogues.text: I did. I think! (he chuckles, then gets serious) Look Alex, if I hadn’t taken the leap from student to writer, a detective named Don Piper would still be locked up somewhere in my imagination. (to Celine) Ooh, honey, did you bring it? Celine reaches into her pocketbook, pulls out a copy of Coop’s new book: “Murder on the Hudson: A Don Piper Mystery” COOP (CONT’D) I wrote you guys a little inscription. It hits bookstores next week.

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: Thank you, Coop.

dialogues.speaker: COOP
dialogues.text: (with false modesty) I’m sure it’s not as brilliant as your new book is going to be, but there’s a couple of decent metaphors in there. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 10/11/06 3rd Pink Revision

dialogues.speaker: CELINE
dialogues.text: Oh, my gosh , Coop, we forgot to tell them the big news.

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: CELINE
dialogues.text: We're pregnant! 12. Celine stands up, revealing a belly-shirt with a stomach rival Britney Spears’. Nancy and Alex gaze at it in shock

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: Congratulations! You just found out?

dialogues.speaker: CELINE
dialogues.text: (patting her impossibly flat stomach) No, I’m four months along! Isn’t that exciting?!

dialogues.speaker: OMITTED
dialogues.text: Al2 OMITTED. EXT. ALPHABET CITY — MORNING A HOMELESS GENTLEMAN sits comfortably in a doorway. He 10 11 Al2 notices something and gets up. As ALEX and NANCY exit, Na hands a dollar to the Homeless Gentleman. (She hands out singles as she walks down the street)

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: I think we should do it. They pass an alleyway containing a SCRUFFY GENTLEMAN.

dialogues.speaker: SCRUFFY GENTLEMAN
dialogues.text: Smoke. Smoke.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: (re: scruffy gentleman) What if we want to buy drugs? You won't find this kind of convenience in Brooklyn. Nancy slaps Alex’s shoulder, playfully. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 10/11/06 3rd Pink Revision 13.

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: We're not going to want to live here once we start having babies. (getting excited) Oh, the upstairs parlor would make the cutest playroom!

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: I’m not sure I want Mrs. Connelly coughing on my baby.

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: (offhand) You know what I mean. Once we have the whole place. Nancy preternaturally senses something and abruptly exits A PILE OF GARBAGE sits against the side of a building. Na zeroes in on a barely visible object and pulls it out. Nancy returns to Alex wielding her find triumphantly.

dialogues.speaker: NANCY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: This’ll make a great lamp!

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: It is a lamp.

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: And it will be again! (dreamily) There are so many wonderful things we could do with that apartment.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: I just wish I wasn’t so close to finishing the book...

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: (playfully selling) What better place to finish that novel than in your own, Nineteenth Century oak writer’s nook!

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: It is a good nook. And it’d be nice to not have to write at Starbucks with the other “novelists”...

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: You deserve a nook of your own. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: B15
dialogues.text: 15 17 Alg 10/11/06 3rd Pink Revision 14. They have reached the subway stop. We hear a FAMILIAR RUM

dialogues.speaker: NANCY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: My train. Nancy kisses Alex. He smiles at her.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Okay. Let’s do it. He kisses her, more deeply. Behind them, a HOMELESS WOMAN stands over a grate as the train rushes by underneath. Th air blows up her skirt; she holds down the skirt and enjo the breeze, though the effect is a little different than was in “Seven Year Itch.”

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A “MURRAY'S MOVERS” moving van is double-parked in the st (the logo -- a smiling Hasid -- the motto: ‘We’ll take yo to the Promised Land’). Several muscular BLACK AND HISPAN MEN emerge from the van, carrying Alex and Nancy’s furnit

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -Alex and Nancy, in jeans and sweatshirts, remove stuff f a box -- it’s belongings precisely labeled. As Alex unloa Nancy crosses off matching items on her CHECKLIST. -Alex takes his rare books from a box, puts them on the A library shelves. -MOVERS set a couch down in the living room. Holding anot FLOOR-PLAN, Nancy directs the movers to move the couch a to the left. Smiles and nods when it’s in the perfect pla -In the bedroom, Nancy consults a FLOOR-PLAN she’s made u for the room -- hangs a large framed WEDDING PICTURE. The newlyweds running through handfuls of rice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Considering they just moved in, almost everything is unpa and in place. The only problem -- the furniture looks hig insignificant in the grandiose space.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: I could've sworn we had more stuff. OMITTED Al9  19 20 10/11/06 3rd Pink Revision 15.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nancy KNOCKS LOUDLY on Mrs. Connelly’s door. Alex examine the bottle of wine. After a couple of seconds, Nancy knoc EVEN MORE LOUDLY. We hear the locks all OPEN, as laboriously as before. INT. MRS. CONNELLY’S APARTMENT 20 The door CREAKS open to the end of the chain, and we agai see Mrs. Connelly’s suspicious eye. Only now it’s surroun by bright blue eye shadow.

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: (a little loudly) Mrs. Connelly? It’s Nancy and Alex! From downstairs! MRS. CONNELLY’S EYE (MOUTH O.C.) Ohhhh. Oh! She SLAMS the door. We hear the chain being UNHOOKED. She opens the door again. Mrs. Connelly, wearing make-up usua reserved for the wake, stands there in a red satin cheong (that mandarin slip dress that was briefly popular 40 yea ago) covered with a tiny, pink sweater jacket.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. CONNELLY
dialogues.text: Come in! Come in!

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: You have a lovely apartment, Mrs. Connelly.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: (offering wine) We got you a little housewarming gift.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. CONNELLY
dialogues.text: (accepting bottle) Oh, I don’t drink, dear. It’s a sin. I’1l open it for you. Mrs. Connelly goes off to the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: (interesting fact) Irish Catholics don’t drink. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 10/11/06 3rd Pink Revision 16. Alex walks toward the bedroom as Nancy takes pictures mentally redecorating.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: Taking pictures... Alex turns and sees

dialogues.speaker: A WALL OF NAUTICAL PARAPHERNALIA
dialogues.text: his gaze wanders down to a desk, on which is an ancient harpoon sits.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Is slightly taken aback. Then he laughs, and picks up the harpoon.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: (turning) Hey, Nancy... Nancy turns.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (pirate voice) Blow me down! The harpoon goes off. It flies by Nancy’s head, missing i inches. It embeds in the wood trim behind her.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh God. Alex rushes frantically to Nancy.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Are you all right?

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: Yeah, I -- (turning) Oh, God! She rushes to where the harpoon is embedded. She freaks.

dialogues.speaker: NANCY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: This is original trim! (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 10/11/06 3rd Pink Revision 17.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: It’s okay. We own it.

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: (mortified) I know!

dialogues.speaker: MRS. CONNELLY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Just two secs! Panicked, Alex yanks the harpoon out of the wood and struggles to quickly jam it back into the gun. Nancy meanwhile is trying to push together the wood to make the gouge less noticeable. (It’s not that big and not in futu shots.) She licks her fingers and smooths the splinters d Alex rushes to the desk and lays the harpoon gun down, th scurries back to sit on the couch. Nancy rushes in next t him. They both sit there pretending nothing has happened. Mrs. Connelly returns.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. CONNELLY, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: Here we go, sit yourselves down, I’ve brought you something to nibble on. Mrs. Connelly places a black lacquer tray on the brass-pl glass coffee table. The tray features a Polynesian dancer, whose toplessness been strategically covered by a bowl full of Bugles™ anda container of Onion Dip, half empty with numerous Bugle™ strafings in it.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Wow, they still make Bugles™, Mrs. Connelly holds a Bugle™ up to the cage. The bird gently takes it by the tip, and rears its head back.

dialogues.speaker: BIRD
dialogues.text: Oh, boy!

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: That’s a great parrot you have there.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. CONNELLY
dialogues.text: He’s not a parrot, he’s a macaw, dear. (uncorking the bottle) (MORE ) (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 10/11/06 3rd Pink Revision 18.

dialogues.speaker: CONNELLY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I’ve had Little Dickie for forty years now. He’s named after my late husband, Richard.

dialogues.speaker: LITTLE DICKIE
dialogues.text: Christ have mercy! As Mrs. Connelly speaks, through the dip. Without under Alex’s nose, close causes the crusty dip to ALEX’S POV Mrs. Connelly looms over MRS. she drags a Bugle methodically saying a word, she sticks it right enough that her minor hand shake get on the tip of his nose. him, selling.

dialogues.speaker: CONNELLY
dialogues.text: It’s French onion. Alex swallows, and smiles. Mrs. Connelly sits down on the couch, too close to Nancy. pats her knees, happily. MRS. CONNELLY (CONT’D) There.

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: How are you feeling, Mrs. Connelly?

dialogues.speaker: MRS. CONNELLY
dialogues.text: Why do you ask, dear?

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: Because the last time we saw you, you were quite ill.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. CONNELLY
dialogues.text: Oh, I had a bit of a cold. I’m in fine fettle now. But do tell me about yourselves. What do you do, Alan?

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Alex.

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: Alex is a writer.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. CONNELLY
dialogues.text: Oh a writer, I always thought of that as more of a hobby than a real job. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 10/11/06 3rd Pink Revision 19.

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: Alex's first novel was published in hardback and he’s about to hand in his second one.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. CONNELLY
dialogues.text: What’s it about dear?

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: I call it an urban epic. It’s about three generations of a family who own a printing press...

dialogues.speaker: MRS. CONNELLY
dialogues.text: (interrupting) Very nice, let me refill that for you. (indicating the portrait behind her) Big Dick had the taste too, he was a seaman. The drink took him from me in 1963. We’d been married for thirty-eight years. Nancy and Alex are doing the math in their heads. MRS. CONNELLY (CONT’D) (breaking the silence) So now, tell me, when might you be having children? Alex finds this question a little forward; Nancy does not

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: Soon.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: In a few years.

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: We've talked about two years.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: (uncomfortable) Depending.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. CONNELLY
dialogues.text: (pouring Alex more wine) You sound just like Mr. Connelly. We never did have children. And it’s too late for me now. Alex and Nancy contemplate this for a beat. In the same s (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 10/11/06 3rd Pink Revision 20.

dialogues.speaker: LITTLE DICKIE
dialogues.text: Blow me down! Panic flashes in Alex’s eyes. Nancy covers up.

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: (genuine concern) Do you have any family at all, Mrs. Connelly?

dialogues.speaker: MRS. CONNELLY
dialogues.text: Ah, yes, quite a big family, at one time. My two baby brothers, Mike and Joe, taken in the floods of 23.

dialogues.speaker: LITTLE DICKIE, (0.S)
dialogues.text: Christ have mercy.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. CONNELLY
dialogues.text: My dear sister Lily found herself on the wrong side of a wheat thrasher one St. Kevin’s day...

dialogues.speaker: LITTLE DICKIE, (0.S)
dialogues.text: Christ have mercy.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. CONNELLY
dialogues.text: Then poor, sweet Uncle Dennis. He died in prison.

dialogues.speaker: LITTLE DICKIE, (0.S)
dialogues.text: Christ have mercy.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. CONNELLY
dialogues.text: Oh, and Little Nuala... she died horribly.

dialogues.speaker: LITTLE DICKIE, (0.S)
dialogues.text: Christ have mercy.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. CONNELLY
dialogues.text: I'm afraid all I’ve left is my sister Alcie. No, no. She’s dead. Twenty years now.

dialogues.speaker: LITTLE DICKIE, (0.S)
dialogues.text: Christ have mercy.

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: I am so sorry. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 21-25 26 10/11/06 3rd Pink Revision 21.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. CONNELLY
dialogues.text: Ah, well, it’s the Irish way. They're all up in heaven waiting for me. Except for Uncle Dennis of course. (noticing) Oh, look at the time. It’s getting so late. Let me show you out. Mrs. Connelly stands to lead them out. Nancy stands with her, though not ready to leave. As Alex rises, a RUDE NOI emanates from his chair. Nancy looks at him askance.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. CONNELLY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh...

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: It was the chair. Nancy gives hima “let’s just drop it” look. Instead Alex turns back to the chair and pumps it with his hand, tryin get it to recreate the sound. He turns back to Nancy.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (under breath, urgent) It was the chair.

dialogues.speaker: LITTLE DICKIE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Oh, boy!

dialogues.speaker: ON MRS. CONNELLY
dialogues.text: She smiles serenely. Alex, Nancy and Mrs. Connelly stand for an awkward moment

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: You know, Mrs. Connelly we never really got to see your apartment. If it’s not too much trouble.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. CONNELLY
dialogues.text: Oh, it’s much too late for that. She says this as she CLOSES the door in Nancy’s face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nancy brushes her teeth, while Alex in tee-shirt and boxe walks in reading a dictionary. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: 3rd Pink Revision 22. I knew it. A macaw is a parrot. He SLAPS the book closed with satisfaction and gets into Nancy enters from the bathroom

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: As her landlords, aren't we legally entitled to see the back of her apartment? I’m gonna check that out on the internet.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: How old do you think she is?

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: My guess is she’s between 90 and 105. She actually looked pretty good tonight, didn’t you think?

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Yeah, she looked almost... That’s nice.

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: It is nice. healthy. Nancy turns out the light. There’s a tiny blaze in the fireplace, bathing them in a flickering glow. Alex’s book collection looks great in the library bookshelves. It’s paradise. Alex gives Nancy a kiss. She kisses of him. Things heating up. They’re clothes when... from above... THE “HAWAII 5-0” THEME song kicks in. both LAUGHING as they stare skyward. INT. UPSTAIRS HALLWAY — LATER Alex knocks on the door.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: him back. Rolls on top pulling off each other's Startled, they stop, Mrs. Connelly! Mrs. Connelly!

dialogues.speaker: MRS. CONNELLY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Huh? Oh, I must have fallen asleep.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Could you turn down your TV, Mrs. Connelly? (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: MRS. CONNELLY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: I’1l do that, Alan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex climbs back into bed. He and Nancy resume their lovemaking. Suddenly, the sound of the TV upstairs gets much louder. and Nancy roll over, exasperated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nancy and Alex lie face up, bleary-eyed. Another TV show drones through the ceiling. Finally, it’s turned off. THE ALARM CLOCK BUZZES...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nancy is dressed for work, heading out the door. Alex sip cup of coffee. Both look kinda tired.

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: Bye, honey. Enjoy your nook.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: I will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex prepares for a day of writing. -He turns on his POWERBOOK. -He puts on music from a MINI-SYSTEM. He adjusts the volu first up then down. -He opens the window a bit. -He adjusts his chair. He sits down -- it’s perfect. The music, the light, the temperature. And as he forms the perfect sentence in his head... and his fingers press down on the keys... THE DOORBELL RINGS.

dialogues.speaker: BY THE FRONT DOOR
dialogues.text: Alex opens the door. Mrs. Connelly stands in the hallway. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 33 10/11/06 3rd Pink Revision 24.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. CONNELLY
dialogues.text: Good morning, Alex.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Good morning, Mrs. Connelly. Can I help you? Mrs. Connelly is holding the bottle of wine from last nig

dialogues.speaker: MRS. CONNELLY
dialogues.text: I wanted to give this back. I won’t drink it and I thought you might want it.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Oh, well thank you very much. And if there’s anything else I can do for you, let me know. Alex closes the door behind her. He notices the bottle is almost empty. Smiles to himself as he takes a step toward the kitchen and... THE DOORBELL RINGS. Alex swings around, opens the door.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. CONNELLY
dialogues.text: There is one thing. INT. MRS. CONNELLY’S APARTMENT - BATHROOM - DAY 33 Alex stands in the claw-foot tub, listening to the wall.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Sorry, I don’t hear any banging.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. CONNELLY
dialogues.text: It was very distinctive. The pipes went bang-bang, bangety-bang-bang. (beat) Bang-bang. Alex presses his ear right up against the wall.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Well, I’m not hearing any banging right now, but, if it happens again, you come right down and get me, and I‘1l run up and have a listen. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 35 10/11/06 3rd Pink Revision 25.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. CONNELLY
dialogues.text: All right then. It’s a deal. Alex heads back down the hall.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. CONNELLY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh, Alex my dear boy, could you give me a hand with the trash. We don’t want to be feeding the mice.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Sure. Alex then sees: an impossibly high pile of assorted garba bags.

dialogues.speaker: LITTLE DICKIE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Oh, boy! INT. “NYNY” MAGAZINE — ART DEPARTMENT — DAY 35 We PAN across several large framed covers of this weekly magazine ending up in...

dialogues.speaker: THE ART DEPARTMENT BULLPEN
dialogues.text: Nancy is huddled around a FLAT-SCREEN MONITOR at a messy with TARA, 20s, downtown vibe. ON THE SCREEN -- there’s a layout of an article.

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: What do you think?

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: It looks good, but maybe you could... (working the mouse, moving things around on-screen) ...-lower the pull-quote and shrink the picture by an eighth so you can squeeze the text onto one page. She neatens up the LAYOUT. It looks better.

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: You’re such a good squeezer, Nancy. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 10/11/06 3rd Pink Revision 26.

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: That’s because until yesterday, I lived in an apartment the size of a small child. Here, check out the new place. ON HER SCREEN -- DIGITAL PHOTOS of her and Alex’s apartme Many are labelled, both to describe what it is “A WRITER' NOOK,” and to show what’s planned, “VELVETY COUCH HERE.” these visuals, Nancy and Tara chat.

dialogues.speaker: NANCY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: So you walk into the living room slash parlor area... notice all the gadrooning...

dialogues.speaker: TARA, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: What’s gadrooning?

dialogues.speaker: NANCY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: I don’t exactly know. But we own lots of it.

dialogues.speaker: HERMAN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Ladies! Ladies! Nancy’s boss, HERMAN, enters. He’s a perpetually harried, middle-aged man.

dialogues.speaker: HERMAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Did you finish the Celebrity Scene page?

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: Tickety boo.

dialogues.speaker: HERMAN
dialogues.text: I don’t know what that means.

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: You’11 have it soon. As he exits the office...

dialogues.speaker: HERMAN
dialogues.text: If you mean soon, say soon. Tickety boo is just confusing for everyone. He’s gone, Nancy and Tara turn back to computer. It’s a picture of Alex in the bathtub, a sign pointing to “MR. PEABODY.” (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 36 10/11/06 3rd Pink Revision 27.

dialogues.speaker: TARA, (0.S)
dialogues.text: Mr. Peabody? Like the cartoon dog?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Several overstuffed garbage bags sit in the lobby, waitin be taken outside. As Alex, dirty and panting, hauls anoth packed bag down the stairs, it breaks, refuse spilling al over the steps. Alex bends down, scooping the garbage back into the bag. Without noticing, he picks something up, about to put it the bag when he realizes it’s a pair of RATTY BLOOMERS. Just then, Mrs. Connelly walks out, with a small trash ca

dialogues.speaker: MRS. CONNELLY
dialogues.text: What are you doing with me drawers?

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: (defensive) What?! No-no, they were in the trash.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. CONNELLY
dialogues.text: (mortified) They most certainly were not. They were... Oh, dear. Hand them back, please.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: (handing them back) No, really...

dialogues.speaker: MRS. CONNELLY
dialogues.text: We won't speak of it again, Mr. Rose. She hands him the trash can. MRS. CONNELLY (CONT’D) Don’t forget to separate the paper from the plastic now. She heads back upstairs. MRS. CONNELLY (CONT’D) (under breath, sounds like: ) Degenerate. Alex stands helpless in the garbage.  10/11/06 3rd Pink Revision 28. EXT. MIDTOWN — AFTERNOON — ESTABLISHING A wide, expansive shot drifting toward the plaza of one particular building. EXT. NYNY BUILDING — ENTRANCE — CONTINUOUS Several people mill under the eaves of the entrance, smok One klatch consists of Nancy, Tara and TERRENCE, a co-wor (This is the Terrence who appears later at the party. Als Nancy does not need to be smoking as long the other are).

dialogues.speaker: TERRENCE
dialogues.text: So, when do we get to see this mansion of yours?

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: (embarrassed laugh) It is a mansion, isn’t it? Oh my God, are we insane?

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: Hey, as long as you can afford it.

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: Barely. Not really. Oops. Nancy giggles.

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: I wouldn't worry about it. I mean, you are getting promoted to Deputy Art Director. Nancy pretends she has no idea what Tara is talking about

dialogues.speaker: TERRENCE
dialogues.text: Everybody knows, Miss Kendricks.

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: And Alex's book will probably make some money...

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: It is so good. And it so great that he has his own place to write now. He’s easily distracted.

dialogues.speaker: TERRENCE
dialogues.text: And we're coming over when? (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 38 39 40 10/11/06 3rd Pink Revision 29.

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: We're having a housewarming, but first I want to... our old stuff doesn’t really live up to space...

dialogues.speaker: TERRENCE
dialogues.text: Ka-ching!

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: (swearing oath) No. It’s all going to be flea market or garbage picked. Behind Nancy, a particularly prickly Herman pushes throug the revolving door. He steps up to the three, demanding a explanation with his petulant stance.

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: Hey, we’re smoking here!

dialogues.speaker: HERMAN
dialogues.text: I need “Fashion Finds” and “Street Smarts” before you go home. Herman stalks back inside. The three share a lip-curling his expense.

dialogues.speaker: TERRENCE
dialogues.text: Honestly. I don’t know why I sleep with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex furiously scrubs his hands with soap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nancy bounds up the steps, holding a few shopping bags, passing several stuffed GARBAGE BINS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex is passed out on the bed. The front door opens...

dialogues.speaker: NANCY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Alex? His eyes pop open, he jumps off the bed, smoothing out th covers. He rubs his eyes, exits into...  10/11/06 3rd Pink Revision 30. 4l THE PARLOR/LIVING ROOM AREA 41

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: Hey, handsome.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Hey. How was work? They peck on the lips.

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: Fine. You know, Herman’s freaking out as usual. (noticing his appearance) Were you napping?

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Um, no, I was just reorganizing my book collection.

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: So... how was the nook? Did you write like a million pages today?

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: No, more like five or six... words.

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: What happened. It’s too sunny?

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: No, our upstairs neighbor kept me busy with chores most of the day.

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: Really? Maybe you just have to set some boundaries with her. Tell her you're working, she’1l understand.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: (noticing her bags) What’s that?

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: Oh! I picked up a couple things on the way home. (pulling out a small area- rug) It’s an area-rug, do you love it?!

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: It doesn’t seem to cover much of an area. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 43 10/11/06 3rd Pink Revision 31.

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: It’s a runner. It goes in between the rooms, to tie them together. She pulls out a small stool. Suddenly, INT. MRS.

dialogues.speaker: NANCY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: ...this is based on an original Alvar Aalto design.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: What is it, a guacamole bowl or something?

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: No, silly, it’s a stool.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: What are we... Hobbits? they hear a LOUD BANGING on the second floor.

dialogues.speaker: CONNELLY'S BATHROOM
dialogues.text: MR. DZERZHINSKY, a large Russian man stands in the tub. T entire wall has been torn open. He uses a PIPE-WRENCH to bang in some new copper piping. Nancy and Alex watch, aghast.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. CONNELLY
dialogues.text: (to Nancy) I told your husband about the problem this morning. The pipes were going... bang-bang, bangety- bang-bang... bang-bang.

dialogues.speaker: MR. DZERZHINSKY
dialogues.text: Very dangerous. Whole bathroom could've exploded. (handing Alex a bill) This is for you.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: (looking at the bill, then his watch) You were here three hours?

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: Sweetie, didn’t you hear him banging around up here?

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: I was asleep. I must’ve missed it. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 44 10/11/06 3rd Pink Revision 32.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. CONNELLY
dialogues.text: Napping in the middle of the workday... shameful.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Look, I’m not gonna pay for something I didn’t authorize.

dialogues.speaker: MR. DZERZHINSKY
dialogues.text: I did the work, my friend. Or, I can rip the pipes out of the wall.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: No, no. Just plug it up, I’1l get a check.

dialogues.speaker: THE FRONT DOOR
dialogues.text: Mrs. Connelly talks with Nancy.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. CONNELLY
dialogues.text: I begged Mr. Rose to do something but he wouldn’t listen. The whole apartment was shaking, Nancy. I was terrified.

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: Next time, you try me at work before you call for any repairs, okay? Here’s my card. Nancy hands Mrs. Connelly her card. Alex stands, waiting for Nancy. He hears a RUDE NOISE O.S It’s Little Dickie. He stares at Alex. He makes another R NOISE.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. CONNELLY
dialogues.text: Oh, Alex, before I forget, it’s the first of the month. She patters over to a counter, retrieves a small stack of money. Counts it out into Alex's palm.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. CONNELLY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Twenty.. forty.. fifty.. fifty-five... sixty.. sixty-five.. seventy.. seventy- five.. seventy-six... seventy-seven... seventy-eight.. seventy-nine.. eighty- one... eighty-two...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 45 46 35 48 10/11/06 3rd Pink Revision 33.

dialogues.speaker: LITTLE DICKIE
dialogues.text: His head is bobbing, keeping count with her.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. CONNELLY, (0.S)
dialogues.text: Eighty-three.. eighty-four...

dialogues.speaker: LITTLE DICKIE
dialogues.text: Eighty-three... Eighty-four...

dialogues.speaker: MRS. CONNELLY
dialogues.text: Eighty-five... eighty-six.. eighty- seven... eighty-eight... She removes a coin purse from her pocket. MRS. CONNELLY (CONT’D) Eight-eight twenty-five.. fifty... seventy-five.. eighty-nine dollars... and twenty-five, thirty-five, forty- five, fifty cents. Would you like to count it? Alex forces a smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A cup of coffee in his hand, Alex walks Nancy down the st to the sidewalk.

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: Remember, if she bothers you, just lay down the law. Be nice... but firm. Two positives and then a negative.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: I’1ll try to remember that.

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: Don’t wait up, I’m working late, okay?

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Okay... I love you. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 49 50 10/11/06 3rd Pink Revision 34.

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: Love you too. Nancy heads down the street, Alex watches her go. INT. THE APARTMENT - WRITER’S NOOK - MORNING 49 Alex, a pot of coffee next to him, is at his computer. As his fingers land on the keyboard... THE DOORBELL RINGS. He gets up, determined.

dialogues.speaker: BY THE FRONT DOOR 50
dialogues.text: Alex opens it onto Mrs. Connelly.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. CONNELLY
dialogues.text: Good morning, Alex.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Good morning, Mrs. Connelly.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. CONNELLY
dialogues.text: Alex, I wondered if I could ask you a quick question.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Now, Mrs. Connelly, let me just take a moment to explain my situation to you. As you know, I’m a writer, and I have a book contract, and an editor, Jean, who expects me to hand in my book in the next three weeks.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. CONNELLY
dialogues.text: I see.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Well, what that means is that, during the day, even though it may not seem like it, I’m actually at work. It’s as if I'ma lawyer at a law-firm. But instead of going to an office, I work from home. So, unless it’s an emergency, from 9 to 6, I’m not available. After that, I'd be happy to help you with whatever you want. Okay? (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 10/11/06 3rd Pink Revision 35.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. CONNELLY
dialogues.text: I completely understand. And I apologize for bothering you. It’s just... (pulls a copy of a BOOK from a bag) I bought your book yesterday, and I wondered if you’d sign it. Of course, if you’re too busy, I can come back after business hours. She hands Alex a copy of his novel, “Crying in the Sprinkler.” Alex clearly feels guilty for being such a je

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: No, I'd be happy to sign it. You didn’t have to buy it though, I could've given you one.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. CONNELLY
dialogues.text: It was money well spent. Just write something I’1l be able to treasure for many years to come.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Okay. He opens the book, sees a sticker that reads: ‘99 Cents!’ Tries to ignore that, as he inscribes the book.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: There you go. I hope you enjoy it.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. CONNELLY
dialogues.text: I know I will. Good day. As she gets to the door, she turns around.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. CONNELLY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh, Alex, I know we just had this discussion, but, well, I was wondering if the firm of Rose and Rose might accompany an old lady to the pharmacy. It’s raining like the Devil’s dew drops out there and I need to renew my monthlies. Won’t take any time at all. She looks at him with puppy-dog eyes.  52 53 55 10/11/06 3rd Pink Revision 36.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Connelly counts out each individual pill from a medi bottle, Alex and a congenial PHARMACIST watching her.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. CONNELLY
dialogues.text: Thirty six... thirty seven... thirty eight...

dialogues.speaker: MAN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Stan, how much for the Nicoderm packets?

dialogues.speaker: PHARMACIST
dialogues.text: $3.99 a box.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. CONNELLY
dialogues.text: Oh, dear, I lost my place. (then, from the beginning) One... two... three...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Connelly packs pennies into a penny roll.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. CONNELLY
dialogues.text: Ninety-six, ninety-seven, ninety eight, ninety-nine... We PAN OVER to reveal Alex, next to her, quickly counting another roll.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Connelly is picking grapes off a vine, putting them plastic bag.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. CONNELLY
dialogues.text: Twenty-one, twenty-two, twenty- three... Alex, grabs the grapes, starts counting them, quickly.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: (super-fast) Twenty-four, twenty-five, twenty- six, twenty-seven, twenty-eight, twenty-nine, thirty! (looks up) Good? (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 58 59 60 10/11/06 3rd Pink Revision 37.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. CONNELLY
dialogues.text: Perfect. (then, noticing) Ooh, blueberries.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex and Nancy are in bed together.

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: I thought you were gonna have a talk with her.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: I did! I was very clear, but she somehow... manipulated me.

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: She manipulated you.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: She’s very crafty. A very crafty, old... lady. From upstairs, the TV comes on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex and Nancy are both in a deep, deep sleep. Suddenly, from outside, LOUD CACKLING AND BANGING. Their eyes open. Without saying a word, they turn to each other, play a qu round of ROCK, PAPER, SCISSORS to see who has to check it out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nancy lost. She peeks her head out the door. Two OLD BIDDIES are lugging large INSTRUMENT CASES up the door.

dialogues.speaker: OLD BIDDY
dialogues.text: It’s a cold one for November.

dialogues.speaker: OLD BIDDY
dialogues.text: That fat man on the television said we may be getting a ‘Nor Easter. ON HER LANDING -- Mrs. Connelly sees Nancy.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. CONNELLY
dialogues.text: Oh, Nancy, good morning! Gertie, Ruth, this is Nancy Kendricks. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 10/11/06 3rd Pink Revision 38.

dialogues.speaker: BIDDIES
dialogues.text: Hello!

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: Are those musical instruments?

dialogues.speaker: MRS. CONNELLY
dialogues.text: Yes, we're a brass trio. We’ve got a big concert at Saint Augustus on Friday.

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: Isn’t that nice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nancy and Alex listen to a cacophony of horns from upstai

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: It sounds like “Every Breath You Take.” They sit quietly for a beat.

dialogues.speaker: NANCY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Let’s go shopping. 62 INT. FLEA MARKET -— DAY 62 Nancy is walking along when a DEALER calls to her.

dialogues.speaker: DEALER
dialogues.text: Do you still want it?

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: DEALER
dialogues.text: Okay! You win. She smiles, turns around to retrieve her peacock as Alex finds her, holding a manual typewriter.

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: Hey, what’d you get?

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: A Remington Royal. Fifty bucks.

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: What were they asking? (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 63 67 68 10/11/06 3rd Pink Revision 39.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Fifty bucks. Nancy frowns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The place is looking great. There’s a fire roaring in the living room. Newly purchased pieces are smartly mixed in with the old stuff. Nancy finishes laying down an antique rug in front of the fire. She and Alex take in their surroundings.

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: I love our home.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: It looks pretty good.

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: Oh my god, I just realized something. We still haven't christened it. She kisses him. The two of them fall to the rug, ripping each other’s clothes off as we MOVE to the fire and...

dialogues.speaker: THE FIRE
dialogues.text: It’s burned down considerably. We PULL away from the fire just as Nancy rolls off Alex, both in post-coital bliss.

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: (slightly out of breath) I love... our home. And as she turns her head, she sees...

dialogues.speaker: MRS. CONNELLY
dialogues.text: standing behind the refracted glass of the stairwell, her face spookily distorted.

dialogues.speaker: NANCY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Ah! Alex turns his head, sees what Nancy’s looking at. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 10/11/06 3rd Pink Revision 40.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Oh my god! They quickly/awkwardly try to cover themselves with their loose clothing as Mrs. Connelly exits the brownstone.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What was she doing?! You think she saw the whole thing?!

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: Ew! I don’t know! Did we say anything dirty?! They hear the front door SLAM SHUT. Alex realizes...

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Wait, this is my chance. I have to go up there.

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: A69 ON AN ELECTRONICS STORE BAG
dialogues.text: In his tee-shirt and boxers, Alex pulls out “CLAP-MATE!”

dialogues.speaker: NANCY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What is that?

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Clap-Mate! You’re the lookout. If you see her coming back, knock on the ceiling. 69 INT. MRS. CONNELLY’S APARTMENT - DAY 69 Alex is under Mrs. Connelly’s ancient TV like an auto mechanic, installing “CLAP-MATE!”

dialogues.speaker: LITTLE DICKIE
dialogues.text: (RUDE NOISE)

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Shut up! 70 INT. NANCY AND ALEX’S APARTMENT - CONTINUOUS 70 Her back to the window, Nancy auditions various spots for antique peacock. Through the window, we see Mrs. Connelly climbing the steps into the Brownstone.  71 72 10/11/06 3rd Pink Revision 41. INT. MRS. CONNELLY’S APARTMENT - CONTINUOUS 71 Finished, Alex stands up, pulls the power knob -- turning the TV. A show comes on. He CLAPS TWICE, the TV shuts off

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: (to himself) Yes! Suddenly, THE FRONT DOOR OPENS.

dialogues.speaker: LITTLE DICKIE
dialogues.text: Mommy’s home! Panicked, Alex runs to the back of the apartment just as. Mrs. Connelly enters. She walks over to Little Dickie, op the leftovers.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. CONNELLY
dialogues.text: I brought ya a treat, Dickie. Hot dogs! Lemme give it a wee chew first. She chews on a piece of frank, reaches her hand into her mouth, feeding Dickie the now-mushy hot-dog. She heads to the back of the apartment.

dialogues.speaker: THE BATHROOM 72
dialogues.text: She begins filling the tub.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Connelly starts to disrobe. MUSIC: Spandau Ballet’s “True.” (ALTS: Bryan Ferry’s “Slave to Love,” Led Zepplin’s “Kashmir,” Sade’s “Sweetest Taboo,” Muddy Waters, “Backdo Man," Dylan’s“Lay Lady Lay,” Springsteen's “I’m on Fire,” Morrison’s “Moon Dance.”) Mrs. Connelly’s bra falls to the floor. Onto Alex’s shoe. PAN UP to show him crouching next to the claw-foot tub, looking quite panicked. A pair of ratty bloomers float down, covering the bra. Th may very well be the same panties Alex fished out of the garbage, as they have a tiny piece of spaghetti stuck to them. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 74 75 76 77 78 10/11/06 3rd Pink Revision 42. Alex anxiously shakes the unmentionables off his foot. He tries to crawl under the tub. No room. We hear the water stop running. The pipes groan. Alex freezes. She’s getting in!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nancy moves the peacock an inch, steps back, satisfied. Then... from upstairs, she hears the pipes groan.

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: Holy crap.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. CONNELLY
dialogues.text: steps into the water ALEX listens in terror as Mrs. Connelly lowers herself in the tub.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. CONNELLY
dialogues.text: <low moan of pleasure>

dialogues.speaker: BY THE FRONT DOOR 75
dialogues.text: Nancy lets herself in, looking around, nervous. MRS. CONNELLY’S HAND Squeezes water onto her stomach with a sponge. The hand presses the sponge to the skin, caressing it, moving downward.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE HALLWAY 77
dialogues.text: Nancy tentatively calls out...

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: Mrs. Connelly?

dialogues.speaker: MRS. CONNELLY
dialogues.text: Nancy? Oh, it so nice to see you. I’1l make ya a cup of tea. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 80 10/11/06 3rd Pink Revision 43. Nancy cranes her neck -- no Alex. Then, she looks up -- through the frosted glass of the bathroom window, Nancy s Alex, crouched like a cat on the windowsill. She breathes a sigh of relief, but then, Alex slips, desperately CLAWING at the frosted window, and he disappe

dialogues.speaker: MRS. CONNELLY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Ooh, they’re lovely...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nancy rushes into the apartment.

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: Honey?

dialogues.speaker: ALEX, (0.S., FAINT)
dialogues.text: Out here! Nancy rushes to an open window and looks down at

dialogues.speaker: THE BUSHES
dialogues.text: Alex is sprawled in a thorny mess of branches, struggling get out while being pricked at every movement.

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: Baby! Are you okay?

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: What happened to you?! You were supposed to be the lookout!

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: I’m sorry. (thinking) What were you doing in Mrs. Connelly’s bathroom?

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: (dryly) — It got complicated.

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: (not wanting to push it) Oh. Oh-kay. (then) Hey, I found the perfect spot for Mr. Peacock. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 81 10/11/06 3rd Pink Revision 44.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: That’s wonderful, honey. Alex struggles and gets pricked.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: If you could, perhaps, give me a hand? I’m slowly bleeding to death.

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: Poor baby. Nancy ducks her head in.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: All right, ready? Here we go. Alex CLAPS TWICE. They wait, but nothing happens. He stan up on the bed, raises his hands to the ceiling -- another couple of LOUD CLAPS. The TV remains on. He jumps on the bed, towards the ceiling, CLAPPING TWICE, LOUDLY... THE TV SHUTS OFF. Nancy and Alex are thrilled.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It worked!

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: You're a genius! He hops back into bed -- for once, the room seems incredi peaceful. As they hold each other, imagining a night of restful sleep... FROM ABOVE -- they suddenly hear... CLAP-CLAP. Mrs. Connelly’s TV turns back on, the horrible noise of a late-night INFOMERCIAL coming into their bedro

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: How the hell did she know?!

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: You didn’t leave the box, right? ON ALEX -- as a wave of realization washes over him. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: B90
dialogues.text: 10/11/06 3rd Pink Revision 45. Then, from above, they hear... CLAP-CLAP. The TV goes off CLAP-CLAP. The TV goes on. The CLAP-CLAPPING continues, a Alex and Nancy listen to Mrs. Connelly play with her new

dialogues.speaker: OMITTED A90
dialogues.text: INT. “NYNY” MAGAZINE - DAY B90 The office is in a state of controlled chaos. Everyone's getting ready for the magazine to go to print.

dialogues.speaker: HERMAN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Royal purple! Not purple purple! Nancy’s phone rings. She picks it up.

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: (into phone) Nancy Kendricks.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. CONNELLY
dialogues.text: Is on the phone, referring to a small card

dialogues.speaker: MRS. CONNELLY, (OVER PHONE)
dialogues.text: Nancy, it’s Mrs. Connelly. Your tenant. I’m calling the number on this card you gave me. Two-one- two...

dialogues.speaker: HERMAN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Ladies? Emergency! Nancy motions to Tara to deal with it. Tara exits. Mrs. Connelly can be heard finishing the phone number.

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: Mrs. Connelly, we're printing our Magazine today, so things are a little crazy here right now. Did you try Alex?

dialogues.speaker: MRS. CONNELLY
dialogues.text: on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. CONNELLY
dialogues.text: I need my laundry picked up. And I'm afraid your Mr. Rose has shown a bit too much interest in my underthings....  10/11/06 3rd Pink Revision 46.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Nancy listens as she tries to work.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. CONNELLY, (ON PHONE)
dialogues.text: Just the other day...

dialogues.speaker: HERMAN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Hurry! Run! Tara re-enters, holding a MARKED UP copy of an article.

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: (quietly) Herman’s changes on the Restaurant Hot List. He didn’t read it until this morning. She hands the article to Nancy, who immediately begins ma the changes on her computer as she half-listens to Mrs. Connelly.

dialogues.speaker: HERMAN, (0.S)
dialogues.text: Nancy, our magazine is going to go to press in 27 minutes!

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: Okay, thank you, Mrs. Connelly... Nancy hangs up.

dialogues.speaker: HERMAN
dialogues.text: Where’s my new Hot List, girls? Herman enters.

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: I’m almost done!

dialogues.speaker: PHONE
dialogues.text: It starts ringing again.

dialogues.speaker: HERMAN
dialogues.text: Five seconds!

dialogues.speaker: ON NANCY TYPING
dialogues.text: As the phone rings, and: (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 10/11/06 3rd Pink Revision

dialogues.speaker: HERMAN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Tickety boo!

dialogues.speaker: NANCY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Okay, okay...

dialogues.speaker: NANCY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Coming! Nancy works in fast-motion. ON HER SCREEN, she drags a 47. FOLDER TO THE TRASH -- ejects the disk, sticks a label on

dialogues.speaker: HERMAN
dialogues.text: Times up! Out of breath, Nancy puts the disk in Herman’s hands. The phone continues to ring incessantly over the following.

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: Here! Herman exits.

dialogues.speaker: HERMAN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: This is a procrastinator’s paradise! 90 INT. ALEX AND NANCY’S APARTMENT - NIGHT 90 Tiny pumpkins and ears of Indian corn on the spiral stair suggest a Thanksgiving theme. Several HOUSEWARMING GIFTS on a table, near hors d’oevres, salads, etc. Alex shows Coop around.

dialogues.speaker: COOP
dialogues.text: I like it, Alex. It’s really cute. What’s it, like, eight, nine hundred square feet?

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: No, it’s like eighteen hundred. Maybe all the fireplaces make it seem... cozier. We've got three fireplaces.

dialogues.speaker: A91 IN THE KITCHEN
dialogues.text: Ag1 Nancy gives the still impossibly flat-stomached Celine a -- the dividing wall has been removed.

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: So here it is, the third fireplace. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 10/11/06 3rd Pink Revision 48.

dialogues.speaker: CELINE
dialogues.text: This apartment is amazing.

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: I’m so glad that you like it. Phew!

dialogues.speaker: IN THE LIBRARY
dialogues.text: JEAN, a tall, handsome woman nurses a white wine.

dialogues.speaker: JEAN
dialogues.text: Tell me, how’s the ending turning out?

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: It’s coming along. I mean, I lost a little time, between the move and getting settled but--

dialogues.speaker: JEAN
dialogues.text: Just make sure you turn it in by Wednesday, Alex. Management is being very strict with our mid- level authors.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: I’m only mid-level?

dialogues.speaker: JEAN
dialogues.text: Right now. Of course you won’t be after you hand in your masterpiece.

dialogues.speaker: THE LIVING ROOM
dialogues.text: Nancy leads Herman, Terrence, Tara and Celine on a tour.

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: We're still replacing a lot of the furniture, but I’m going with a Miller slash Eames look. You love Eames, Terrence.

dialogues.speaker: TERRENCE
dialogues.text: Nancy, I just got a new piece!

dialogues.speaker: B91 THE LIVING ROOM B91
dialogues.text: Back on Coop and Alex. They discuss Coop’s elephant skin jacket. Alex looks across the room, where a tough-looking guy in 40s, CHICK and his curvaceous, busty date, GINGER stand. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 10/11/06 3rd Pink Revision 49.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Did you bring that guy?

dialogues.speaker: COOP
dialogues.text: Oh, that’s Chick. He’s the guy who’s advising me on the Don Piper mysteries.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: What, he’s a detective or something?

dialogues.speaker: COOP, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Just the opposite. Drugs, extorsion, killing, loan sharking, you name it. Guy’s a real dirtbag.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX, (ADR)
dialogues.text: You invited a dirtbag to my party?

dialogues.speaker: COOP
dialogues.text: Relax, he’s very discreet. He’s got a perfectly legitimate day job as a cover. ON CHICK, GINGER, HERMAN, TERRENCE and TARA.

dialogues.speaker: HERMAN
dialogues.text: What do you do, Chick?

dialogues.speaker: CHICK
dialogues.text: I’m a pornographer. Everyone smiles and nods, hiding their surprise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The group walks up the stairs, towards Mrs. Connelly’s.

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: She's this funny old Irish lady named Mrs. Connelly. She’s playing in a brass ensemble at her church tonight. They get to Mrs. Connelly’s door, Nancy sticking in a key unlock it. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 94 95 96 97 10/11/06 3rd Pink Revision 50.

dialogues.speaker: NANCY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: There’s all sorts of incredible details, I mean I can’t wait for you guys to see... Herman and Terrence stick their face in to see:

dialogues.speaker: MRS. CONNELLY
dialogues.text: Coming at them with a can of mace.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: A FULL BLAST OF MACE is suddenly sprayed through the door

dialogues.speaker: MRS. CONNELLY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Intruder! INT. NANCY AND ALEX’S APARTMENT 94 Everyone assembled suddenly hears...

dialogues.speaker: TERRENCE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Aaahhhh!!!

dialogues.speaker: BACK ON THE LANDING 95
dialogues.text: Terrence clutches his face. Herman, GAGGING, staggers backwards and down the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: Herman?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An AMBULANCE pulls out. A SQUAD CAR idles in front, light flashing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An imposing cop, OFFICER DAN, has his arm around Mrs. Connelly, who looks very much the victim. Alex and Nancy on the landing. In the b.g., the PARTY GUESTS file out.

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER DAN
dialogues.text: Being a landlord doesn’t give you the right to enter your tenant’s premises any time you feel like it. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 10/11/06 3rd Pink Revision 51.

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: We just wanted to give our friends a little look-see. (to Mrs. Connelly) I thought you were performing at the church tonight.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. CONNELLY
dialogues.text: Heavens no. It’s next Friday. We've got a big week of practice ahead of us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Officer Dan re-gains his attention.

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER DAN
dialogues.text: You had no right entering in the first place. You terrified this poor woman. Mrs. Connelly, you could press charges if you want to.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: What?!

dialogues.speaker: MRS. CONNELLY
dialogues.text: Oh, no, I don’t want to do that. They're such a nice couple. (heads into her apartment) Goodnight, now. As the door closes, Officer Dan turns back to Alex and Na

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER DAN
dialogues.text: (writing a citation) You got off easy this time, but I‘1l be watching you two very closely. He hands Alex the citation. Chick and Ginger exit Alex an Nancy’s apartment, Chick motioning for Ginger to wait whi he heads up the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: CHICK
dialogues.text: Hey, Alex, right?

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Yes... Chick? From his jacket, Chick hands Alex a stack of PORNO DVD'S.

dialogues.speaker: CHICK
dialogues.text: I brought you a little housewarming gift. (to Nancy) (MORE ) (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 99 100 10/11/06 3rd Pink Revision 52.

dialogues.speaker: CHICK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It’s all tasteful stuff, you know, for couples.

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: That’s thoughtful.

dialogues.speaker: CHICK
dialogues.text: (points to a movie) My card’s inside “Ass Patrol” if you need some more.

dialogues.speaker: GINGER
dialogues.text: I won an award for that one. INT. “NYNY” MAGAZINE - ART DEPARTMENT - MORNING 99 Nancy walks up to her work-station. A yellow POST-IT on h computer reads: “See me - H.” CLOSE ON HERMAN’S FACE It’s red and puffy and really, really pissed. INT. “NYNY” MAGAZINE - HERMAN’S OFFICE - CONTINUOUS 100 ON NANCY -- in shock.

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: That’s not fair. She was supposed to be at church. You can’t fire me because you got Maced. ON HERMAN -- his arm in a sling, his face red and puffy.

dialogues.speaker: HERMAN
dialogues.text: Oh, believe me, I wish that’s why I was firing you. He throws the Winter Preview issue on his desk.

dialogues.speaker: HERMAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Did you happen to see the Restaurant Hot List? Nancy opens it to a Post-It-marked page.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE MAGAZINE
dialogues.text: One page is taken up with: ‘WINTER'S HOTTEST RESTAURANTS. There’s clearly been a screw-up on the second page becaus instead of the Hot List... THERE'S A DIAGRAM OF NANCY’S PLANS FOR THEIR APARTMENT (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 103 10/11/06 3rd Pink Revision 53. In each of the different rooms, there are PHOTOS of Nancy and Alex's heads, pasted on little cartoon bodies, with s captions accompanying the pictures.

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: (slowly, stunned) Oh... my... god... WE PUNCH in on various images on the page: Alex at his nook, writing (the caption: ‘Great American Novel!'); Alex and Nancy in bed, cuddling; in the kitchen cooking (the caption reading ‘Yum!’). ] Further down the page, Nancy’s vision for Mrs. Connelly’s place. Alex and Nancy with a baby in a nursery (Mrs. Connelly’s parlor); Alex, in a home-gym (her bedroom), lifting a barbell like a strongman; Alex and Nancy sit in an antiqu bathtub, Nancy loofah-ing Alex’s back. An arrow points to Alex (the caption, ‘Alex!’); a second arrow points toward his crotch (the caption reads: ‘Mr. Peabody!’)

dialogues.speaker: HERMAN
dialogues.text: How’s Mr. Peabody?! INT. APARTMENT —- WRITER’S NOOK - DAY 103 Alex has the magazine opened to the diagram, as he angril punches in a number on the telephone. From Mrs. Connelly’s apartment, a song -- John McCormick singing “She Moved Through The Fair” plays loudly.

dialogues.speaker: RECEPTIONIST, (OVER PHONE)
dialogues.text: “NYNY,” can I help you?

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Nancy Kendricks please.

dialogues.speaker: RECEPTIONIST, (OVER PHONE)
dialogues.text: I’m sorry, Mrs. Kendricks no longer works here.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: RECEPTIONIST, (OVER PHONE)
dialogues.text: May I help you with anything else? Alex hangs up the phone. The music from above, driving hi nuts. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 104 105 10/11/06 3rd Pink Revision 54.

dialogues.speaker: OUT THE WINDOW
dialogues.text: He notices Mrs. Connelly strolling past with a small MUSI INSTRUMENT CASE, Little Dick perched on her shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN MCCORMICK RECORD
dialogues.text: (skipping) Till our wedding day... till our wedding day... till our wedding day. He looks over to the house-keys in a bowl near the front door. Then, his eyes go his desk, where he sees the $3,00 fine for trespassing. Alex grabs a broom, using it to BANG on the ceiling sever times. Plaster falls, hitting him on the face. And he momentarily FREAKS-OUT, spastically punching the a in anger and frustration.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nancy exits a cab with several BOXES of her office possessions. At the same time, Mrs. Connelly returns, stopping Nancy as she walks up the steps.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. CONNELLY
dialogues.text: Good evening, Nancy! I left a small grocery list on your tape recording at work. Did you manage to fill it for me?

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: (bewildered but apologetic) No, I- Mrs. Connelly turns away, a little peevish.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. CONNELLY
dialogues.text: That’s all right. It won’t be the first dinner I’ve missed in my life. Mrs. Connelly enters the Brownstone, letting the doors CL on Nancy who struggles with her pile of boxes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nancy opens the front door, stops short...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 10/11/06 3rd Pink Revision 55. Alex is asleep in the fetal position on the couch, the magazine by his side. The McCormick song is still skippin from upstairs.

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: Alex! He quickly opens his eyes. Sees her dragging in her boxes

dialogues.speaker: NANCY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You can’t sleep! You have to finish your book! We need money! I got fired!

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: (waking up now) Yeah, I know. I saw it.

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: You saw it?

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Now my parents knows my penis is called Mr. Peabody.

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: It wasn’t my fault! (points upstairs) She had me on the phone while you were napping!

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: I wasn’t napping! I told you I was hiding from her! I CAN’T WRITE A

dialogues.speaker: ANCHORS AND STOOLS TO PAY FOR
dialogues.text: WOMAN IS RUINING US! WE’RE

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: Alex it’s okay. You just need to get out of the house. Why don’t you go write at a Starbucks or something?

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: And you’1l stay home alone with her all day? I’m telling you won’t be able to take it, Nancy. (MORE ) (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 10/11/06 3rd Pink Revision 56.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I mean, I love you, but I’ve been there, and I don’t think you could take it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex walks in to a pretty empty Starbucks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nancy is on the phone at her kitchen table -- a list of contacts displayed on the Titanium Powerbook in front of

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: I was at "NYNY" for four years, freelance before that and...

dialogues.speaker: SFX
dialogues.text: Nancy rolls her eyes. INT. BROWNSTONE — FOYER — CONTINUOUS Mrs. Connelly rings the bell in an annoying rhythm.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. CONNELLY
dialogues.text: Nancy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nancy opens the door and talks to Mrs. Connelly.

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: Good morning, Mrs. Connelly.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. CONNELLY
dialogues.text: Well, hello, Nancy. I couldn’t help but notice that Alex left the house this morning, while you stayed home. Is everything all right?

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: Actually, I was uh... downsized from my job.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. CONNELLY
dialogues.text: Oh, I’m sorry.

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: Is there something... Mrs. Connelly? (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 10/11/06 3rd Pink Revision 57.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. CONNELLY
dialogues.text: I guess you could call it something! I’ve got somethin’ on display in my kitchen. Mrs. Connelly flashes Nancy a big smile. 111 INT. MRS. CONNELLY’S APARTMENT — KITCHEN 111 There’s a small black object on the counter.

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: That’s not a mouse dropping. It’s a raisin.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. CONNELLY
dialogues.text: (leans in to look) It’s the leavings of a mouse.

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: (losing patience) It’s a raisin. Nancy matter-of-factly picks up the object and pops it in mouth. She gets a very strange look on her face.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. CONNELLY
dialogues.text: Oh, I sprayed it with Lysol. 112 INT. NANCY AND ALEX’S BEDROOM - NIGHT 112 Nancy and Alex in bed, Alex types on his Powerbook while Nancy rants.

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: ..-and she puts on this sweet face and pretends to be all innocent. (imitates Mrs. Connelly) ‘Oh, Nancy, come quick, I found the leavings of a mouse.’ Like she didn’t know it was a raisin.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: (typing) : That’s nice sweetie. She looks over at him, frustrated, as he types furiously, paying attention to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It’s raining. Alex exits with an umbrella, gives Nancy a little kiss.  114 117 10/11/06 3rd Pink Revision 58.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex enters -- sees that every seat is filled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex looks in the window -- several REGULARS already into their first drink of the day. He enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He walks up to the bar, lays out his Powerbook in front o the world-weary FEMALE BARTENDER

dialogues.speaker: BARTENDER
dialogues.text: What can I get you?

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Look, I have about twelve hours to finish this book I’m writing. Can I just sit here, all day, and work?

dialogues.speaker: BARTENDER
dialogues.text: Be my guest. (points to an OLD MAN, scribbling in a notebook) He said the same thing, thirty seven years ago. Alex looks over at the old man, PHIL, slightly disturbed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nancy’s on the phone, the CLASSIFIED ADS in front of her.

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: ...-I haven’t designed religious leaflets per se, but I’m sure I'd be very good at it. (listens) One o’clock. Great, I'll see you then, Rabbi. Then... from somewhere... AN ECHOEY VOICE.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. CONNELLY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Nancy! Nancy are you down there?! Nancy looks around -- could it be in her head? But then, eyes land on THE DUMBWAITER SHAFT.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE DUMBWAITER SHAFT 118
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 10/11/06 3rd Pink Revision 59. Nancy opens it up, looking up. She sees Mrs. Connelly looking down.

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: What is it, Mrs. Connelly?

dialogues.speaker: MRS. CONNELLY
dialogues.text: Little Dick is caught in the dumbwaiter shaft.

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: How did he get-- Suddenly, LITTLE DICK appears out of the darkness... screeching horribly as he ATTACKS NANCY, firmly planting talons into her hair. It’s like something out of “The Bir

dialogues.speaker: NANCY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Aahh!

dialogues.speaker: DOWN SHAFT ON NANCY
dialogues.text: Being attacked.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. CONNELLY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Stop struggling! It just makes him angry!

dialogues.speaker: THE APARTMENT
dialogues.text: Nancy stumbles out of the dumbwaiter shaft, running throu the apartment, desperately trying to detach the pecking a squawking Little Dickie from her head.

dialogues.speaker: LITTLE DICKIE
dialogues.text: <squawk> Oh, boy! Christ have mercy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nancy runs into the foyer with the bird still attached. M Connelly exits from her apartment.

dialogues.speaker: LITTLE DICKIE
dialogues.text: Christ! Christ! <squawk> Oh, boy!

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: Abhh!i!i!!! Nancy finally manages to rip Little Dick off her head, an the bird flies up to the second floor, where Mrs. Connell grabs hold of him. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: MRS. CONNELLY
dialogues.text: (gently stroking Li’l Dick) Shame on ya, scaring a helpless little macaw like that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex types furiously, a mug of coffee next to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nancy, her face slightly pecked up, exits the apartment i JOB INTERVIEW SUIT, carrying her portfolio case. She look up, sees Mrs. Connelly exiting her apartment.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. CONNELLY
dialogues.text: Oh, Nancy, I was just about to ring you. I’m afraid there’s a bit of a problem up here.

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: (not so nice) I’m on my way to a job interview, Mrs. Connelly. I'’11 have to take care of it later.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. CONNELLY
dialogues.text: That’s okay, I’1l just call a rugman?

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: The what? Nancy sighs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex is typing like a madman. Finally, he POUNDS one more key, looks up from the screen pumps the air, exultant!

dialogues.speaker: B142
dialogues.text: 10/11/06 3rd Pink Revision 61.

dialogues.speaker: A142
dialogues.text: Her portfolio cases next to her,Nancy quickly hammers nai into the CARPET-RUNNER at the top of the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. CONNELLY
dialogues.text: Nail it down good now, I wouldn't want to slip and break my neck..

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: Nope, you wouldn’t want to do that. Mrs. Connelly leans down.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. CONNELLY
dialogues.text: This is the problem area, here.. She rips up a section of nailed-down runner, the popping out in succession. MRS. CONNELLY (CONT’D) ...it’s looser than a Dublin whore. (re: Nancy’s hammering) There ya go, put a little elbow grease into it.

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: Okay, I will. And in a flash... Nancy suddenly pushes her down the stairs. nails Mrs. Connelly tumbles end over end, until she lands with THUD at the bottom of the steps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nancy and Alex sit in a booth -- Alex looking stunned.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: You threw Mrs. Connelly down the stairs?!

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
