dialogues.text: No, of course not! But I imagined it! And I liked it! I’m evil. I’m a horrible, horrible person.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: You’re not horrible. That woman has practically ruined our lives. (MORE ) (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 10/11/06 3rd Pink Revision 62.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It’s perfectly normal to have thoughts like that. I’ve even had a couple of harmless ones myself.

dialogues.speaker: OMITTED 145
dialogues.text: 146 THE EAST RIVER — NIGHT 146 ALEX TOSSES the SQUIRMING MRS. CONNELLY IN A SACK INTO TH RIVER.

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: Like what?

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: (casually) Just, you know, snapping her neck, electrocuting her... Just beating her to death... Decapitating her, drowning her, bludgeoning her, but asphyxiating her first so she didn’t feel anything.

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: (smiling) You’re evil too!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex and Nancy walk up the steps, hand in hand, Alex carr his Powerbook.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: It was incredible. The last sixty pages just poured out of me.

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: Let’s open up that really good champagne, have a little celebration. As they approach the front door, they hear Mrs. Connelly SCREAMING O.S.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: c149 10/11/06 3rd Pink Revision 63. INT. BROWNSTONE - NIGHT B1l49 They enter the building, see Mrs. Connelly outside her do

dialogues.speaker: MRS. CONNELLY
dialogues.text: Alex, Nancy, come quick! A huge rat just ran under me cupboard. Alex and Nancy look at each other.

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: I’1l pop the cork. She smiles at him, he heads upstairs. INT. MRS. CONNELLY’S APARTMENT - MOMENTS LATER c149 Alex enters the apartment, Mrs. Connelly leading him to h living room. A fire blazes in her fireplace. Alex sets his POWERBOOK CASE on her coffee-table, next to phone book (which is from 1970).

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: (doesn’t believe her at all) Well, let’s just see if we can’t find this big-bad-rat. Alex leans down, looks under the cupboard. Sees nothing b a thick layer of dust.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You sure it wasn’t a dust-bunny? Those things kind of scurry when you--

dialogues.speaker: MRS. CONNELLY
dialogues.text: I saw it with my own two eyes. It was the size of a cocker spaniel.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: I’m sorry, I just don’t--

dialogues.speaker: MRS. CONNELLY
dialogues.text: The rat! Alex whips his head around -- sees THE SMALLEST MOUSE IN WORLD dart across the room. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: E149
dialogues.text: 10/11/06 3rd Pink Revision 64. Mrs. Connelly reaches towards the coffee-table, grabbing Alex’s Powerbook instead of the phone book, hurls it at t scurrying mouse. The computer crashes to the floor, missing the mouse, but hopping RIGHT INTO THE FIREPLACE.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: No-no-no!

dialogues.speaker: MRS. CONNELLY
dialogues.text: Oh, dear, your purse fell into the fire. Alex fights the fire, trying to get at his computer. MRS. CONNELLY (0.S.) (CONT’D) Mind now, you’re getting ashes on my rug!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His jacket and Powerbook engulfed in flames, Alex flies d the stairs, passing Nancy who opens their door holding a bottle of CHAMPAGNE.

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: Alex?!

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Door-door-door-door! She runs to the door, avoiding his flaming hands, shaking champagne bottle in the process. She opens it as...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ..-Alex leaps out of the brownstone,trips and lurches forward, the SMOKING COAT/LAPTOP flying out of his hands. SLOW MOTION -- as the Powerbook soars through the air, landing, not-so-gently on the street -- burnt, but salvageable. Alex breathes a sigh of relief when... A TOW-TRUCK barrel over the computer, as well as the SUV that it tows. And as Alex takes this in, horrified. The champagne Nancy holding opens with a FESTIVE POP.  10/11/06 3rd Pink Revision 65.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Above them, Mrs. Connelly’s TV blares. The water stain in the corner of their ceiling continues to grow.

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE NEWSCASTER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: ..-accompanied by nausea and violent diarrhea. Doctors warn that this Indonesian strain of the flu is particularly dangerous and potentially deadly to young children and especially the elderly. Nancy and Alex watch this silently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex, wearing slacks and a sport-coat walks toward the do

dialogues.speaker: MRS. CONNELLY
dialogues.text: Oh, Mr. Rose. Alex looks up, sees her at the top of the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. CONNELLY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Could you sprinkle some salt on the steps? They’re terribly icy.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: You better not go outside then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex exits. Through the door, we see him take a terrific FALL down the steps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex explains his story to Jean, who seems to be buying i shaking her head in disbelief.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Yes! And then I got it outside, tripped, and a tow-truck ran it over. Followed by an SUV.

dialogues.speaker: JEAN
dialogues.text: Alex, no, that is horrible! (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 10/11/06 3rd Pink Revision 66.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: (chuckling with her) I know. Can you believe it? Beat. Then, Jean gets serious.

dialogues.speaker: JEAN
dialogues.text: No, I can’t. I tried to warn you, Alex. We’re canceling every contract that’s in breach.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: In breach.

dialogues.speaker: JEAN
dialogues.text: I’m sorry, darling. Maybe if you put as much energy into your work as you do into excuses, you’d have made the deadline. (to waiter) I’1l have the shark. No bones... EXT. MIDTOWN — CONTINUOUS Nancy and Tara, in coats and hats, exit a deli which has various Thanksgiving decorations in its windows; Tara is carrying a plastic bag with the lunch she has just bought

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: In a way, you’re lucky. Herman has been a superdick since you left. They begin walking down the street, past mostly successfu people. Perhaps they pass a book store that is plastered posters for Coop’s latest book.

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: Lucky? I can’t find a job, I’m going to lose my apartment, my husband and I haven’t made love in weeks. All because of goddamn Mrs. Connelly...

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: (shocked) Alex is having an affair with Mrs. Connelly?

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: No! It’s just... (really upset) (MORE ) (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: + eH +e %

dialogues.speaker: C156
dialogues.text: 10/11/06 3rd Pink Revision 67.

dialogues.speaker: NANCY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: All I ever wanted was a nice home, a couple of bedrooms, clawfoot bathtub, a day room for a baby... (realizing) How can I have a baby with no sex?

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: Oh, sweetie, I am so sorry. If there’s anything I can do. I don’t have any money.

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: No, I don’t want... But could you keep an eye out, ask around about a job?

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: (uncomfortable) Nancy, I don’t know... You’re pretty famous, in an infamous kind of way. Maybe in a couple of years. Nancy looks doomed. An old woman passes them, COUGHING.

dialogues.speaker: TARA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I hope I don’t get that flu. I’ve got so much freelance work to do. (off Nancy’s look) Sorry. (lifts up plastic bag) Would you like half my sandwich? Nancy thinks about this for a second.

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A glum Alex is smashed in among commuters. He notices a WOMAN reading a NEW YORK POST -- the cover reads: “KILLER FLU STRIKES AGAIN.” Alex glances across the car, sees tha there are several EMPTY SEATS next to one VERY SICK-LOOKI BUSINESSMAN. Alex stares at the guy, who’s coughing, sneezing, shaking head in misery. The subway goes into a tunnel -- the lights shorting out a moment. A dark figure moves forward. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He HHH HH FH HH HH HHH FF HH FH HHH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 156 157 10/11/06 3rd Pink Revision 68. The train emerges from the tunnel, heading out to Brookly daylight now filling the car. Alex stands, facing the very sick-looking businessman.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: How’s it going? The Businessman coughs. Alex leans in to breathe from it. The Businessman SNEEZES. Alex swings his face through the mist, in the agonized ecstacy of a martyred saint.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nancy and Alex lie in bed, looking incredibly sick.

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: How do you feel?

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Like I’m knocking on death’s door. ON MRS. CONNELLY’S DOOR Knock-knock! INT. MRS. CONNELLY’S APARTMENT - MINUTES LATER Mrs. Connelly opens her front door onto Alex and Nancy, trying, futilely, to look healthy.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. CONNELLY
dialogues.text: Oh, look who’s here!

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: Hi, Mrs. Connelly!

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: (hitting the ‘H’) Happy Thanksgiving.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. CONNELLY
dialogues.text: Come in, dears. Are you feeling okay? You both look a bit sallow? 156 157 They walk in, casually touching surfaces as they head tow the sitting area. Alex half-stifles a sneeze.

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: No-no, we're fine. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 158 10/11/06 3rd Pink Revision 69.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: We brought you some popcorn. Seated now, Nancy puts her hand over Mrs. Connelly’s, lea in close to her face.

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: Did you manage to get a little turkey, Mrs. Connelly?

dialogues.speaker: MRS. CONNELLY
dialogues.text: I did. That lovely black woman from the Post Office brought me a sumptuous dinner.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Wasn’t that sweet of her. Alex smiles at her, rubs his sniffling nose, then, runs t same hand over her armchair.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. CONNELLY
dialogues.text: But I’m afraid some of the carcass didn’t go down the disposal. Nancy and Alex suddenly look concerned.

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: That’s ‘cause you don’t have a disposal, Mrs. Connelly.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. CONNELLY
dialogues.text: I don’t? INT. MRS. CONNELLY’S KITCHEN - MINUTES LATER 158 CLOSE ON THE SINK -- it’s a greasy cesspool with skin floating on the surface, glops of turkey bones, mashed potato, cranberry sauce churning in it. Ales lies under the sink, inexpertly struggling to loosen elbow joint. Nancy is above the sink, looking down. BELOW -- the joint suddenly jars loose, and Alex sees a l piece of GELATINOUS FAT lodged in the pipe. He takes the handle of a wire brush and jabs at the grist One, two, three. On the third poke the fat FLIES straight of the drain and LANDS ON NANCY’S FACE like a jellyfish. Nancy gags, spits, looks like she’s gonna...

dialogues.speaker: BELOW
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 10/11/06 3rd Pink Revision 70. Alex is delighted.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: All right! Alex looks up the pipe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nancy vomit down the drain. Alex is covered with vomitus.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. CONNELLY
dialogues.text: watches this casually.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. CONNELLY
dialogues.text: I don’t care what ya say, looks to me like you’ve got some sort of bug. Thank god Officer Dan took me to get a flu shot last week.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON A MURAL OF BROOKLYN -- real estate agent Kenneth standing in front of the Brooklyn Bridge, arms extended. Nancy and Alex sit in front of it, who look horrible.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: (all business) How much can we get, Kenneth?

dialogues.speaker: KENNETH
dialogues.text: That depends on how much you come down on the price. (off Alex’s stare) You way overpaid, and what, with that tenant...

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: You said she was a sweet old lady...

dialogues.speaker: KENNETH
dialogues.text: I can’t imagine saying that.

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: So you're telling us we’re stuck with that hell-hole? (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 10/11/06 3rd Pink Revision 71.

dialogues.speaker: KENNETH
dialogues.text: Yeah, unless you’re willing to take a huge, huge loss.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Huge?

dialogues.speaker: KENNETH
dialogues.text: (correcting) Huge huge. Alex and Nancy look extremely distressed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It’s cold and bright. The poles are striped for Christmas Alex and Nancy huddle together for warm and comfort.

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: We are so screwed.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Yes. We are that.

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: (at wits end) What are we going to do? We don’t have a “huge, huge” to lose even if we wanted to. Oh, Alex, what’re we .+. I mean, we already tried to... “K" her...

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: (momentarily confused, then indignant.) We did not. Nancy can’t believe he would say that.

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: Alex! The flu? We... She pantomimes wiping her nose with her sleeve as she did earlier. Alex lowers his eyes like a very bad little boy. Nancy and Alex walk silently for a beat.

dialogues.speaker: NANCY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (eyes welling) We’re horrible! (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 10/11/06 3rd Pink Revision 72.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: No. No!

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: We’re such bad people!

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: No, our brains were infected with super viruses. We were probably legally insane.

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: We've got to make it up to her.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: (incredulous) What? I feel bad. But not that bad.

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: (brightening) Maybe we could buy her a gift, or flowers, a little cake... and just very politely explain our situation... And then we could ask her if she wouldn't mind leaving...

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Have you ever met this Mrs. Connelly?

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: Okay, well maybe we’ll have to beg a little. But nicely.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: (considers, agrees) She might go for begging... An open box of Godiva™ chocolates. An elderly thumb pushe deep into one of them. INT. MRS. CONNELLY’S APARTMENT — PARLOR — CONTINUOUS Mrs. Connelly frowns, and thumbs another chocolate. Alex Nancy sit across from her, not looking well.

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: Mrs. Connelly, there’s a chart showing what’s inside each chocolate. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 10/11/06 3rd Pink Revision 73.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. CONNELLY
dialogues.text: (thumbing a chocolate) That’s all right, dear. Mrs. Connelly picks up a chocolate apparently to her liki and puts it in her mouth. She makes a face and spits it o into her hand. She places the wet chocolate back into its spot in the box.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: So, Mrs. Connelly, the reason we...

dialogues.speaker: MRS. CONNELLY
dialogues.text: (not listening) You two are the nicest landlords I’ve ever had! So many of them were not very nice at all, in the end.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: You've had a lot of landlords?

dialogues.speaker: MRS. CONNELLY
dialogues.text: Gobs and gobs! Ten in the past eight years, if you can believe it. Mrs. Connelly hands Nancy a photo album. MRS. CONNELLY (CONT’D) My rogue’s gallery, if you will. Nancy opens the album, and starts turning the pages.

dialogues.speaker: ON ALBUM
dialogues.text: It’s page after page of young couples like Alex and Nancy

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Nancy and Alex stare as they turn the pages.

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: All these people owned this apartment and then moved out?

dialogues.speaker: MRS. CONNELLY
dialogues.text: Well, they didn’t all move out. Poor Mr. Myer took his own life. (entre nous) Had money problems. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: +e * HF  10/11/06 3rd Pink Revision 74.

dialogues.speaker: ON ALBUM
dialogues.text: The procession continues. Some of the couples are in what clearly sixties and seventies garb.

dialogues.speaker: ON ALEX AND NANCY
dialogues.text: Mortified. MRS. CONNELLY (CONT’D) Smile! They look up. They are blinded by a flash of light.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. CONNELLY
dialogues.text: Has just taken their picture with a camera. MRS. CONNELLY (CONT’D) (delighted) And now I’ve got you two! Alex and Nancy blink, from the flash and in disbelief. Al turns his head down as he blinks and sees...

dialogues.speaker: THE BOTTOM OF THE BIRD STAND
dialogues.text: Is papered with pages from a book. Clearly visible is the page Alex inscribed to Mrs. Connelly, “To my favorite upstairs neighbor...” In that moment, bird shit lands on

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Is that my novel?

dialogues.speaker: MRS. CONNELLY
dialogues.text: I’m sorry, Alan, I couldn’t read it. It was filthy dirty. (to Nancy) Mr. Connelly hid his dirty books inside the toilet tank. Nancy squeezes Alex’s arm tightly. He swallows his rage.

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: Mrs. Connelly, let me come right to the point: Alex and I are trying to have a baby.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. CONNELLY
dialogues.text: (knowing, judgemental) I saw. In the living room. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 10/11/06 3rd Pink Revision 75.

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: Right. But the thing is, when we do... have our baby. Well, we're going to need this upstairs.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. CONNELLY
dialogues.text: I don’t understand, dear.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: We're willing to pay you. Something.

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: In installments.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. CONNELLY
dialogues.text: You want me to leave?

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Don’t you want to be with people who are more... in your demographic?

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: In beautiful, sunny Miami Beach?

dialogues.speaker: MRS. CONNELLY
dialogues.text: I’m Irish, dear. I'd sizzle up like a sausage.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Then how about the Bronx? It’s loaded with Irish people. Right off the boat.

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: Gobs and gobs of them.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. CONNELLY
dialogues.text: Oh, you wouldn’t catch me in the Bronx after dark. Besides, this is my home. Why, my Mr. Connelly is buried out in the back. (thinks) Somewhere.

dialogues.speaker: LITTLE DICKIE
dialogues.text: Christ have mercy! Nancy blinks, stunned. Alex’s eyes flit back and forth, desperately, trying to think of... (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 10/11/06 3rd Pink Revision 76.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: (getting idea) Home! The emerald isle! (crappy Irish accent) Back to the old sod! Alex does a leprechaun bounce of the head, then realizes embarrassing himself and stops. He and Nancy look forlorn

dialogues.speaker: MRS. CONNELLY
dialogues.text: Well, now, there’s a thought... Nancy and Alex are initially more shocked than pleased. MRS. CONNELLY (CONT’D) (thinking it through) I haven't been back home in fifty years... But I do still have the old family cottage in Connemara. With her eyes she indicates a painting/photograph on the of what might more properly be called a manor house. Alex and Nancy regroup and go for the sale.

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: Ireland is so beautiful. Green.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: And they're in the EU now... Nancy gives Alex a look. He shrugs. Mrs. Connelly nods he head, smiling...

dialogues.speaker: MRS. CONNELLY
dialogues.text: Well, I'd have to give it some thought... (thumbing chocolate) Ooh, a caramel! Mrs. Connelly pops the chocolate in her mouth. MRS. CONNELLY (CONT’D) Most likely they’ve got television by now...

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: Oh, I’m sure they do.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Color! (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 10/11/06 3rd Pink Revision 77. Mrs. Connelly’s mouth is open as she mulls. Her tongue sl circumnavigates the chocolate. Alex and Nancy are on the edge of their seats, their excitement tempered by revulsion. Mrs. Connelly snaps her mouth shut and nods happily. She’ made up her mind.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. CONNELLY
dialogues.text: (cheerily) You know, I’ve got half a mind to-- Mrs. Connelly suddenly stops talking.

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: Mrs. Connelly? Mrs. Connelly is turning red. She’s CHOKING. Alex jumps up and hoists Mrs. Connelly out of her chair. Heimlich’s her violently, several times. The chocolate fl out.

dialogues.speaker: ON NANCY
dialogues.text: The chocolate splats onto her forehead.

dialogues.speaker: ON ALEX
dialogues.text: Relieved, Alex relaxes his grip on Mrs. Connelly. She instantly drops out of frame. We hear a DEAD THUMP. Nancy drops to Mrs. Connelly’s side, feels her neck pulse

dialogues.speaker: NANCY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh, God!

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Clear! Alex slams his fist down on Mrs. Connelly chest, like he’ seen on TV.

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: What are you doing?!!

dialogues.speaker: CPR.
dialogues.text: Nancy pushes Alex away, and starts doing real CPR. Alex l on helplessly. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 10/11/06 3rd Pink Revision 78.

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: Give her mouth-to-mouth! Alex is terrified. But dutifully, he opens Mrs. Connelly’ mouth and blows in. He comes up for breath, starts to blo again. Mrs. Connelly eyes snap open. He backs off, startl

dialogues.speaker: MRS. CONNELLY
dialogues.text: What are you doing? Mrs. Connelly’s POV Alex is at a loss for words. His mouth is also smeared wi lipstick. She looks down. Nancy is straddling her and has her hands Mrs. Connelly’s breasts.

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: You choked on chocolate. Mrs. Connelly looks as if she’s just realized something.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. CONNELLY
dialogues.text: Oh. EXT. PARK SLOPE POLICE STATION — AFTERNOON INT. PARK SLOPE POLICE STATION — CONTINUOUS Alex and Nancy sit in front of a desk. Officer Dan sits on the other side, staring at them. Sitt next to him is Mrs. Connelly.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. CONNELLY
dialogues.text: The last thing I remember was eating one of their chocolates, and when I woke, he was having his way and she was holding me down. Alex goes into an explanation. As he gestures, we see the tips of each of his fingers is inky black.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: (shit-eating laugh) She’s confused. What — Officer Dan practically lunges across his desk and grabs Alex’s mouth, digging his thumb and forefinger deep into Alex’s cheeks. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 10/11/06 3rd Pink Revision 79.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Officer Dan’s quite massive face.

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER DAN
dialogues.text: You sicken me.

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: There’s been a misunderstanding. Honestly.

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER DAN
dialogues.text: Both of you, shut up. Officer Dan stands, still gripping Alex’s face. He leans forward. OFFICER DAN (CONT’D) We keep a list of people like you down here at the station, and you’re on that list now. The Sexual Predator list.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: (through pinched face) <dismissive snort> Sexual predator? Officer Dan squeezes his face very hard.

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: My husband is not a sexual predator. I would know. Alex is not sure how to take that.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. CONNELLY
dialogues.text: He stole my drawers once. For sniffing. Nancy looks to Alex alarmed. He starts to try to protest, Officer Dan redirects Alex’s attention with a jerk of his face.

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER DAN
dialogues.text: If I see you, anywhere, in the park, loitering in public rest rooms, approaching a child or elderly person, or a dog, I will shoot you. Officer Dan lets go, and sits down. He picks up the box o Godiva chocolates. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 164 10/11/06 3rd Pink Revision 80. OFFICER DAN (CONT’D) We're having these tested. Mrs. Connelly shakes her head scornfully.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. CONNELLY
dialogues.text: And to think they want to have children! This comment hits Nancy hard. EXT. PARK SLOPE POLICE STATION — AFTERNOON Alex and Nancy exit the station house. They are too devastated and angry to notice the police officers walkin very close by.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: We should have just let her choke.

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: (realizing they could have) Oh, poop! Nancy and Alex turn to each other.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Well, we're not going to make that mistake again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Connelly exits the building, carrying Little Dickie. Alex and Nancy emerge from their apartment wearing black sweatsuit ensembles and gloves. Nancy carries some tools.

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: Go, go, go, we don’t have much time.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: I know, she’s running errands. That only gives us twelve hours. Nancy pushes him playfully as they head up the stairs, in her apartment.  165 10/11/06 3rd Pink Revision 81.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex and Nancy scurry into the apartment, doing recon lik commandoes. They both seem hopped up, and not quite in th right minds. Alex darts about the room, scouting ops. He looks down at

dialogues.speaker: THE CARPET
dialogues.text: With his foot, he scrunches it up a bit, leaving a hazard bulge.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Gives himself a grim thumbs up and moves on.

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: scans the room. Her eyes fall upon a STAND UP LAMP.

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: Bulls-eye.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Crouches down next to a TV tray next to Mrs. Connelly’s chair. He is unscrewing the top of a salt shaker and pour it in the sugar bowl.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: A little salt in the sugar bowl...

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: Is taking apart the lamp. She looks up.

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: Salt in her sugar? What’s that going to do?

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Mulls this.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: (saving face) Well. Maybe if she has high blood pressure...

dialogues.speaker: NANCY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Honey, check this out. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: +e HF

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Roger. Alex turns quickly and rushes to join Nancy, but trips on carpet and goes down.

dialogues.speaker: NANCY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Alex! Alex pops back up and continues toward Nancy.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: I’m all right! Alex approaches Nancy, who has the lamp mostly dismantled

dialogues.speaker: ALEX, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You sure you know what you’re doing?

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: I wired that desk-lamp in our old apartment.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Well, if the shock doesn’t kill her... Alex heads towards the kitchen...

dialogues.speaker: ALEX, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: A little bit of gas poisoning should do the trick. Nancy gives him a thumbs-up, as Alex disappears down the hall.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX AND NANCY
dialogues.text: -Nancy unscrews a light-bulb. 166 -Alex pulls old, greasy trays from the stove’s broiler. 1 -Nancy pulls out two wires from the lamp -- holding a pai wire-shredders in her mouth. -Alex sticks his head in the broiler, blows out the pilot light.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And, out goes the pilot. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 170 171 172 173 174 175 10/11/06 3rd Pink Revision 83. -Nancy uses the wire-shredders to peel off the protective coating on the lamp’s wires. -Alex turns on the oven, hears the familiar HISS of gas.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: An hour at 375 should do it. -Nancy, holding two LIVE-WIRES in her hand, calls out...

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: Did you blow out the pilot for the burners? Alex looks at the oven-knob, hears the gas escaping, sees blue-light of the burner pilot just as... A HUGE FIREBALL ignites in his face...

dialogues.speaker: IN THE LIVING ROOM 174
dialogues.text: Nancy sees Alex BLOWN BACKWARDS PAST THE LIVING ROOM...

dialogues.speaker: NANCY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Honey?! As she cranes her head, she accidentally CONNECTS THE LIV WIRES... SHOCKING HERSELF... her hair standing on end, he eye-balls POPPING OUT OF THEIR SOCKETS and we...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex and Nancy lie in bed, each distinctively fried -- Al red-faced and blistered, Nancy’s hair a frizzy mess. She looks up, sees that the water-stain on the ceiling ha grown over their bed.

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: Alex... the stain is dripping on us.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: I know. Isn’t it soothing? A DRIP OF WATER lands on his forehead. He closes his eyes relief. Then...the water starts coming faster. The drip d drip echoes in Alex’s mind. The wheels start turning.  176 177-178

dialogues.speaker: A180
dialogues.text: 180 10/11/06 3rd Pink Revision 84. INT. MRS. CONNELLY’S APARTMENT - DAY 176 Mrs. Connelly opens the door onto Alex, carrying a tool-k

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: We've got a big water-stain downstairs, Mrs. Connelly. I need to look at the pipes, okay?

dialogues.speaker: MRS. CONNELLY
dialogues.text: What on God’s Green Earth happened to your face? Alex heads to Mrs. Connelly’s bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: I try to keep a tan in the winter. Nancy says it’s flattering.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. CONNELLY
dialogues.text: Flatterin’? You look like a roast mutton. Alex heads into the bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: OMITTED A179
dialogues.text: INT. MRS. CONNELLY’S APARTMENT - LATER 179 Alex has ripped off the temporary piece of wood Dzerzhins used to patch up his hole. He has his tools laid out in t tub.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. CONNELLY
dialogues.text: How you doin’ in there, Mutton- head?

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Almost done. IN THE WALL -- using a wrench, he loosens the joint, lett a steady stream of water out of the pipes.

dialogues.speaker: IN SERIES OF DISSOLVES A180
dialogues.text: We see the deteriation of the canvas ceiling. During the last dissolve the camera follows the fall to the pots and pans below.

dialogues.speaker: THE BEDROOM
dialogues.text: Alex and Nancy under the covers, nervous. Nancy works on TITANIUM POWERBOOK. From above, we hear muted IRISH DANCE MUSIC.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Getting very soggy up there... Alex gets up to check on the hole in the ceiling.

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: You know, as long as we’re putting a hole in the ceiling, this might be a better place for a stair-case. What do you think? She shows Alex her computer screen -- ON-SCREEN, a new diagram of the apartment.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: (distracted) Sure.

dialogues.speaker: BETWEEN FLOORS
dialogues.text: Alex’s head emerges and looks around with a flashlight.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX, (ADR)
dialogues.text: I give these floorboards another week...

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Alex climbs down the ladder.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX, (ADR)
dialogues.text: And then it’s (chipper) “Ding! Ground floor, Mrs. Connelly!” He runs out of the room.

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: Where are you going?! (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: B214
dialogues.text: 10/11/06 3rd Pink Revision 86.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX, (OS)
dialogues.text: A little insurance. He comes back with... NANCY’S ANTIQUE PEACOCK -- it’s plu of sharp, wrought iron feathers sticking in the air. He sets it down, right under the ceiling’s weak-spot.

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: No, Alex, not Mr. Peacock!

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Honey, Mr. Peacock is going to have to take one for the team. A quarter-second later:

dialogues.speaker: THE CEILING 199
dialogues.text: falls in, bringing wood, plaster and LOUD IRISH MUSIC wit it. Alex and Nancy barely escape being killed.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. CONNELLY
dialogues.text: looking down through the hole in her Riverdance outfit.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. CONNELLY
dialogues.text: Jesus, Mary and Joseph! I could’ve fallen right through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A cop-car and an ambulance idle outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Officer Dan speaks with Alex. Two PARAMEDICS work on Nanc The Paramedic lifts her leg, Nancy yelps in pain.

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER DAN
dialogues.text: (inspecting the ceiling) These floorboards have rotted to the core. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 10/11/06 3rd Pink Revision 87.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Mrs. Connelly hired this Russian guy to fix the pipes. He left us with all this water damage. FROM UPSTAIRS -- Mrs. Connelly peeks her head through the hole.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. CONNELLY
dialogues.text: With all due respect to Mr. D, Alex, you did come up two days ago to do your handiwork.

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER DAN
dialogues.text: That’s another fine right there. (like it’s obvious) You can’t plumb without a license in New York City.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Plumb? I can’t plumb? Officer Dan casually loops his thumb through his HOLSTER.

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER DAN
dialogues.text: Are you trying to sass me, Mr. Rose?

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Who’s sassing? Nobody’s sassing. As Officer Dan speaks, Alex’s eyes focus on his GUN...

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER DAN
dialogues.text: No, I didn’t think so. Cause I know city inspectors who eat slumlords like you for breakfast...

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Slumlord, that’s...

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER DAN
dialogues.text: If I were you, I’d fix this ceiling as fast as I damn well could. And... you’re gonna buy Mrs. Connelly a new TV. In fact, I'll pick it out for you myself, Mrs. C.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. CONNELLY
dialogues.text: Could you put in one of those clappy things as well? Nancy and Alex surprised me with one, it makes my viewing so much easier. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 10/11/06 3rd Pink Revision 88. Alex looks up at Mrs. Connelly. She smiles and CLAPS-TWIC EXT. CITY - ALLEY — NIGHT A DRUG DEALER plies his trade. Alex sidles up to him.

dialogues.speaker: DRUG DEALER
dialogues.text: Smoke? Mesc? ‘Ludes?

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: (under his breath) Gun? The drug dealer turns around. He and Alex speak quietly.

dialogues.speaker: SCRUFFY GENTLEMAN
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Gun. I need to buy a gun. You know... for shooting. The drug dealer looks offended.

dialogues.speaker: NANCY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Alex! Alex turns to see

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: standing next to a beat up car being driven by a GUN DEAL

dialogues.speaker: NANCY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I found us a... Un-gay. Nancy makes a gun shape with her hand. The Gun Dealer rol his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: LATER
dialogues.text: Alex and Nancy stand with the Gun Dealer behind the car. both look very nervous. The dealer pops the trunk; it’s loaded with guns. Nancy’s eyes widen.

dialogues.speaker: GUN DEALER
dialogues.text: (suspicious) You two aren’t going on some kind of wild sex-murder spree, are you? (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 10/11/06 3rd Pink Revision 89.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: No, no, nothing like that. (beat) Do we look like the kind of people who would go on a spree?

dialogues.speaker: GUN DEALER
dialogues.text: You look a little crazy, yes.

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: We've been under a lot of stress. Alex points into the trunk.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: How about that? It’s a 44-Magnum, the most powerful handgun on earth.

dialogues.speaker: GUN DEALER
dialogues.text: (derisive smile) Yeah. That’s a little too much gun for you. Here we go. (displaying gun) Black Widow, your basic 22-caliber revolver. Five hundred dollars.

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: It cost half that on the Web! The gun dealer nonchalantly slams the trunk closed.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Five hundred’s fine. Cash, right? The dealer gives him a “what do you think,” stare. Alex counts out almost all of his money and hands it over.

dialogues.speaker: GUN DEALER
dialogues.text: Thanks. One last thing: I’m a cop. Alex and Nancy lose it, crumbling to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: Oh, no!

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: You don’t understand, we’ve haven’t slept in months! She killed my computer! She crippled my wife! (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 10/11/06 3rd Pink Revision 90.

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: We don’t make love anymore! And I miss it so much! The gun dealer cracks a smile.

dialogues.speaker: GUN DEALER
dialogues.text: Just fucking with you. Nancy and Alex get back up, trying to regain their dignit

dialogues.speaker: GUN DEALER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (very matter-of-fact) Okay, now I just gotta give you my standard rap: if you end up in the legal system, and there’s even a suggestion I might have been involved, you are dead, your children are dead. Alex and Nancy get up, SNIFFLING.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: We don’t have any children. (puts arm around Nancy) We're trying. The gun dealer starts to get in his car.

dialogues.speaker: GUN DEALER
dialogues.text: Yeah, well good luck with that.

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: GUN DEALER
dialogues.text: Don’t shoot anybody I wouldn’t shoot. The dealer peels out, spitting garbage at Alex and Nancy. D214 INT. APARTMENT — PARLOR — NIGHT D214

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: So it’s come to this. WIDER -- to reveal Nancy and Alex sitting around the kitc table, a GUN between them. Nancy wears a huge FOOT-CAST.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: I guess it has. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 10/11/06 3rd Pink Revision 91. Nancy picks the gun off the table.

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: I don’t think I’ve ever even held a gu-— As Alex instinctively raises his hand, THE GUN GOES OFF.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO BLACK
dialogues.text: EXT. PARK SLOPE HOSPITAL — NIGHT INT. HOSPITAL — EMERGENCY ROOM — CONTINUOUS Nancy sits by Alex’s side, tightly holding his left hand, a small hospital bed surrounded by a curtained partition. Alex’s right hand is bandaged. A hot, young female reside DR. KANG, nonchalantly briefs him.

dialogues.speaker: DR. KANG
dialogues.text: You were very lucky. Your hand deflected the bullet into the soft tissue of your groin. No major organs were damaged.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: (incredulous) What are--? It went into my--

dialogues.speaker: DR. KANG
dialogues.text: Yes, but it went straight through the meatus. I’ve seen piercings that were worse. (dark chuckle) A lot worse.

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: (worried) But what about... The other things... Down there.

dialogues.speaker: DR. KANG
dialogues.text: (one woman to another) They were unharmed.

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: So we'll still be able to have children?

dialogues.speaker: DR. KANG
dialogues.text: One way or another. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 10/11/06 3rd Pink Revision 92.

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: Oh, thank God. Alex shoots Nancy a look.

dialogues.speaker: NANCY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (again concerned) So how long will he have to stay in the hospital?

dialogues.speaker: DR. KANG
dialogues.text: (to Alex) Oh, you can leave any time. (marking her chart) I’m going to prescribe an antibiotic, keep the bandages fresh, and if there’s any pain, a couple of Advil should take care of it.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: (perplexed) Don’t I need, I don’t know, physical therapy or something?

dialogues.speaker: DR. KANG
dialogues.text: (smile, eyebrow raise) No, just, well, you should probably keep you hands off it for awhile. (smiling, to Nancy) Both of you. Dr. Kang ducks out. Nancy looks at Alex apologetically.

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: Poor Mr. Peabody...

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: (forgiving her) He took one for the team. Officer Dan pops in from behind the curtain.

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER DAN
dialogues.text: (officious) I think I’ve got everything I need here. We’ve got the unlicensed gun charge, and then, pending an investigation... (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 10/11/06 3rd Pink Revision 93.

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: It was an accident!

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER DAN
dialogues.text: It’s been my experience that wives do not accidentally shoot their husbands in the penis. And as much as this particular man may deserved it, spousal abuse is a very serious crime in this state. Now, you two have a good night now... Officer Dan exits. Nancy looks worried, but then Alex’s smiling comforts her.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: He thinks you’re abusing me. Well, you did shoot me.

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: (worried) Oh, honey, I just feel like we’re approaching this whole murder thing the wrong way.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: (indicating crotch with his bandaged hand) Ya think?! She gently strokes his wounded hand.

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: (thinking) Maybe if we kept it simple...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex and Nancy pulls themselves up the dumbwaiter. Alex h a pillow. They whisper.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: This is so not simple.

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: Yeah, but you know she triple- chains the front door at night. As they pull themselves up:

dialogues.speaker: NANCY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: A little more... (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: D216
dialogues.text: 10/11/06 3rd Pink Revision 94.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX, (BACK TO CAMERA)
dialogues.text: Hey, is this my pillow? INT. MRS. CONNELLY’S BEDROOM - MINUTES LATER C216 Nancy and Alex sneak into the bedroom, but there’s no Mrs Connelly.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Where is she?

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: Maybe she’s in her chair...

dialogues.speaker: IN THE LIVING ROOM D216
dialogues.text: Alex and Nancy sneak around, their eyes landing on...

dialogues.speaker: THE CHAIR
dialogues.text: It’s empty. Then something lights up in the darkness behi it. A match being lit. The flame hovers in the air. After moment, the red tip of a cigarette glows, illuminating tw disembodied eyes, staring sternly.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: (quietly) Ah!

dialogues.speaker: MRS. CONNELLY
dialogues.text: You caught me. I can’t help but sneak a fag once in a blue moon.

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: (thinking quickly) Mrs. Connelly, we thought you might be cold, so we brought you an extra pillow. Nancy offers the pillow to Mrs. Connelly, who stands up, edging towards them.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. CONNELLY
dialogues.text: Oh, you're so considerate. So unlike the rest of the landlords. Mrs. Connelly takes the pillow, then begins leading them from the front door. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 10/11/06 3rd Pink Revision 95. MRS. CONNELLY (CONT’D) So many have passed through that downstairs dwelling, but you two, I just know you’re here to stay. They walk around THE HOLE, which is lined with CAUTION! T MRS. CONNELLY (CONT’D) (pointing out flat-screen) Officer Dan put in my new television. It’s a HUGE WIDE-SCREEN PLASMA TV. Neither of them can believe it. MRS. CONNELLY (CONT’D) And he hung these two noise-boxes behind me chair. They turn their heads -- the woman’s got SURROUND-SOUND. Mrs. Connelly pushes them down the hallway. MRS. CONNELLY (CONT’D) Oh, it’s gonna be so wonderful around here. You lovelies, me, Officer Dan. We’re going to be one, big happy family. They're now at the entrance to the dumbwaiter. MRS. CONNELLY (CONT’D) (points to the dumbwaiter) The Irish say it’s bad luck to come in one door and out the other. Has something to do with the dead... They're backed against the dumbwaiter. A tiny squawk. LITTLE DICKIE’S SHADOW On the wall.

dialogues.speaker: LITTLE DICKIE
dialogues.text: Christ have mercy!

dialogues.speaker: ON THE DUMBWAITER
dialogues.text: Alex and Nancy are inside it.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. CONNELLY
dialogues.text: Goodnight, now. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: C216
dialogues.text: 10/11/06 3rd Pink Revision 96.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Good night. He closes the dumbwaiter door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There’s a large piece of SCAFFOLDING with a tarped-in E21 platform under the ceiling hole. Alex and Nancy lie in be

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: That was...without question, the weirdest seven minutes of my life. Then, from above they hear: CLAP-CLAP. And suddenly, in SURROUND SOUND, “The Perfect Storm” begi to play -- music pounding, Clooney and Wahlberg screaming over the roaring sea. The entire bedroom is shaking. Vases fall. Alex’s RARE F2 BOOKS plummet from the library shelves.

dialogues.speaker: UPSTAIRS
dialogues.text: Mrs. Connelly sits in her chair, watching the movie.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. CONNELLY
dialogues.text: (loudly) Captain Connelly battled waves twice that size! The macaw squawks.

dialogues.speaker: DOWNSTAIRS C216
dialogues.text: The noise is deafening. Nancy sweeps up the debris with a broom and dust-pan.

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: I mean, is it us?! Are we doing such a bad job of trying to kill her?! Their WEDDING PICTURE crashes to the floor, the frame SHATTERING.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: No, it’s not our fault! We’re dealing with a freak of nature! Nobody could finish her off! (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 216 10/11/06 3rd Pink Revision 97. The PORNO MOVIES from Chick fall off the top of a dresser landing right next to Nancy. She looks up at Alex...

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: Alex, you said you threw these away!

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: I did! I don’t know how they got there. Alex's eyes land on the “Ass Patrol” DVD.

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: Yeah, right.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Wait a minute... “Ass Patrol.”

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Hand me that “Ass Patrol.” Nancy reluctantly hands Alex “Ass Patrol.”

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A BIG BURGUNDY SEDAN is parked in this remote area. CHICK the pornographer/hitman is in the driver’s seat, Alex rid shotgun. Nancy, leaning over from the back, shows Chick digital photos of Mrs. Connelly’s apartment on her TITANI POWERBOOK.

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: Now, depending on her mood, she might be watching TV over here... or... sneaking a cigarette over in this area. I realize it’s horribly cluttered, but we're going to go for a much cleaner look when we--

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Nancy...

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: CHICK
dialogues.text: What’s the easiest way into this hag’s place? (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 10/11/06 3rd Pink Revision 98.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: We've found the dumbwaiter shaft to be very effective.

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: (showing Chick on her computer ) It’s really not a difficult climb. We can leave the back door open, you could get in from here.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Chick, how much is this going to run us?

dialogues.speaker: CHICK
dialogues.text: Twenty-five K. Alex and Nancy are surprised.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Really, because we were thinking something in a different price range.

dialogues.speaker: CHICK
dialogues.text: Shoot.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: We were thinking more like... Nancy looks to him, encouraging.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: A half K...

dialogues.speaker: CHICK
dialogues.text: The bottom line price for wet work is $25,000 dollars.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Okay. When are you gonna do it?

dialogues.speaker: CHICK
dialogues.text: I‘1l do it Thursday night.

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: Christmas Eve? (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: AD218
dialogues.text: 10/11/06 3rd Pink Revision 99.

dialogues.speaker: CHICK
dialogues.text: Yeah, I have a function to go to, then I’1l swing by and get it done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SIGN advertises a book reading/signing by Cooper Sincla a photo of a cool-looking Coop underneath the sign. WIDER -- a large group of hip attractive PEOPLE are gathe in the store to hear Coop read from his Don Piper series. Alex stands in the back, listening.

dialogues.speaker: COOP
dialogues.text: (reading from his book) Piper grabbed the leash of the only partner he’d ever known, and the private eye and his trusty Jack Russell headed downtown.‘I guess it’s just one of those things worth killing for, huh, Sonny.’ Coop closes his book, sets it down on the table. The crow breaks into wild applause.

dialogues.speaker: MODERATOR
dialogues.text: We'll take a five minute break and come back for Q and A.

dialogues.speaker: BEHIND A ROW OF BOOKS AD218
dialogues.text: Alex and Coop are alone. The crowd is audible in the b.g.

dialogues.speaker: COOP
dialogues.text: $25,000. What the hell do you need that kind of dough for?

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Dental surgery. But extensive and expensive...

dialogues.speaker: ON CHICK
dialogues.text: ALEX (0.S.) (CONT’D) Basically, we’re looking at a whole new lower jaw... (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 10/11/06 3rd Pink Revision 100.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: ..-and now with Nancy losing her job and with me losing the book contract, things have gotten pretty desperate and I wouldn’t even be asking if it wasn’t really serious.

dialogues.speaker: COOP
dialogues.text: I can give you the money, Alex.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: COOP
dialogues.text: But I’m not gonna do it. (off Alex’s look) You're a good writer, Alex. Get off your butt, and finish your damn book.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Coop, I finished my book. The old lady threw it in the fire.

dialogues.speaker: COOP
dialogues.text: Alex, I don’t know if that happened, I don’t know if it didn’t. I don’t care. You need money, earn it, man. The secret to writing is writing. You know how long it took me to write the last Don Piper book?

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: No, I don’t.

dialogues.speaker: COOP
dialogues.text: Four days. Three hundred fifty eight pages in ninety six hours. And you can do it, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex enters, steaming. Nancy’s there waiting for him.

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: What happened, did you get the money? (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: E218
dialogues.text: 10/11/06 3rd Pink Revision 101.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: No, he didn’t think I needed it, but I got a signed first edition for my collection. (holds up the book) Wrote it in four days. You know how? Listen to this. (opens to a page) ‘Her hair was bright yellow, like the color of your pee after you take a multi-vitamin?’ Nice metaphor, asshole! Why don’t you go screw yourself and your stupid loft, and your pregnant wife who’s gonna have the only baby in the world to be born with a six-pack, you freakin’ dick! Alex tries to tear the book apart, but it’s a hardcover, he can’t quite do it. After wrestling with the book for a few seconds, he chucks it against the wall.

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: Alex, it’s okay? We’1ll get the money somewhere else.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Where are we supposed to get twenty five thousand dollars in two days. Alex’s eyes fall upon something. MUSIC: “It’s beginning to look a lot like Christmas.” Nancy sees that Alex is looking at Mr. Peacock. Nancy looks sad. Alex looks to her and shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: A SERIES OF DISSOLVES D218
dialogues.text: We see everything they own disappear. The furniture. Nancy's wedding ring. Alex’s rare book collection. Everything. Then... IN THE BARE APARTMENT, a Christmas Tree appears. Alex ark Nancy decorating it.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: I wonder when he’s gonna do it? (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: B220
dialogues.text: 10/11/06 3rd Pink Revision 102.

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: I don’t know. He’s got that party to go to.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: You think it was a cocktail party, or more of a dinner thing? Suddenly, they hear the BACK-DOOR open.

dialogues.speaker: BACK OF THE APARTMENT F218
dialogues.text: Nancy and Alex sneak around the corner -- through the darkness, they see Chick enter the DUMBWAITER SHAFT. Chick flips through the cash. Satisfied, he starts to cli the dumbwaiter. Then... the front door BUZZER BUZZES. Alex and Nancy look each other, concerned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex and Nancy tentatively walk towards the front door. T open it onto... A GROUP OF YOUNG KIDS, CAROLING.

dialogues.speaker: CAROLERS
dialogues.text: God Bless Ye Merry Gentlemen whose notice sudden is... Nancy and Alex fake-smile for the kids. INT. MRS. CONNELLY’S APARTMENT - CONTINUOUS A220 The dumbwaiter opens. Chick is inside, wielding a giant knife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The kids finish the song, and Officer Dan emerges behind them, holding a box of CHRISTMAS COOKIES.

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER DAN
dialogues.text: Good job, kids.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Officer Dan!

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: What a pleasant surprise. He starts heading upstairs. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 10/11/06 3rd Pink Revision 103.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Where are you going?

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER DAN
dialogues.text: Upstairs to give Mrs. C some holiday cookies. Nancy and Alex try to block his way.

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: That’s okay. We’ll bring it to her.

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER DAN
dialogues.text: (distrusting) No, I think I’1l bring her the holiday cookies myself. Be right back, kids. He walks past Nancy and Alex, heading upstairs. 221 INT. MRS. CONNELLY’S APARTMENT - CONTINUOUS 221 Chick enters the parlor. Mrs. Connelly is in her chair, facing away from him. She is fast asleep. Chick shakes hi head, smiling. This is too easy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Officer Dan makes his way up the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: (reeling from the slap) ow! Officer Dan whips his head around.

dialogues.speaker: E223 IN THE APARTMENT E223
dialogues.text: Chick hesitates for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: F223 IN THE FOYER F223
dialogues.text: Nancy continues pummelling Alex. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 10/11/06 3rd Pink Revision 104. She POUNDS and SLAPS him as a stunned Alex tries futilely defend himself. The CAROLING KIDS are extremely upset -- SEVERAL ARE CRYING.

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER DAN
dialogues.text: (cunning down the stairs) There are children here! The heck is wrong with you people?! He separates Nancy from Alex. OFFICER DAN (CONT’D) I knew there was domestic abuse going on in this house! The kids still crying.

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER DAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (heads outside) I'm going to come back in about ten minutes. And he’s gone. Alex and Nancy exchange looks.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE APARTMENT
dialogues.text: Hearing the outside door close, Chick starts advancing on Mrs. Connelly, the knife itching in his palm. He hears something. He turns.

dialogues.speaker: A DARK FIGURE
dialogues.text: Flies across the room, looming like a bat.

dialogues.speaker: LITTLE DICKIE
dialogues.text: <Squawk>

dialogues.speaker: CHICK
dialogues.text: Is spooked. He exhales audibly.

dialogues.speaker: THE DARK FIGURE
dialogues.text: lands atop Mrs. Connelly’s chair, a raven-like silhouette Mrs. Connelly, her back still to Chick, opens her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. CONNELLY
dialogues.text: I knew they’d send a pro. She swivels in her chair. She has the harpoon in her lap. shoots it.  223 10/11/06 3rd Pink Revision 105. INT. ALEX AND NANCY’S APARTMENT - CONTINUOUS They look up, alarmed.

dialogues.speaker: UPSTAIRS 223
dialogues.text: Chick has a LARGE HARPOON lodged in his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: CHICK
dialogues.text: Aaaahhhhh!!! You shot me!

dialogues.speaker: MRS. CONNELLY
dialogues.text: I got ya, you brute. Who are you, bringing a knife to a gun fight! Chick struggles with the harpoon, and Mrs. Connelly holds tight to the other end. Mrs. Connelly yanks on the gun. T harpoon is yanked around in Chick’s chest. He YELPS. MRS. CONNELLY (CONT’D) Ah, scream like a man, will ya?

dialogues.speaker: CHICK
dialogues.text: recovers his rage. He comes at Mrs. Connelly with the kni

dialogues.speaker: MRS. CONNELLY
dialogues.text: Raises the harpoon gun and shoves the butt into CHICK’S FACE. Chick staggers, dropping the knife. Mrs. Connelly drops the gun, kicks the knife aside with h foot, and adopts a classic bare-knuckled fighter’s stance Mrs. Connelly rabbit-punches, ducks, weaves, does a 360 a comes back with a roundhouse punch to Chick’s chest. MRS. CONNELLY (CONT’D) Mr. Connelly was five times the fighter you are!

dialogues.speaker: CHICK
dialogues.text: You bitch! Chick staggers at Mrs. Connelly like a drunken sailor. Sh headbutts him.  10/11/06 3rd Pink Revision 106.

dialogues.speaker: DOWNSTAIRS
dialogues.text: Alex and Nancy are confused, then alarmed when they hear:

dialogues.speaker: MRS. CONNELLY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: <scream>

dialogues.speaker: UPSTAIRS
dialogues.text: Mrs. Connelly’s scream continues but we see neither her n Chick. Chick staggers in the frame. Mrs. Connelly is on his uppe back, her knees pinned around his ribs. She continues hit him about the head and face. MRS. CONNELLY (CONT’D) If you want to dance with me, you gotta buy me a drink first! Chick bends back to throw Mrs. Connelly off. As he does s Little Dickie swoops in and digs his talons into Chick’s crotch. MRS. CONNELLY (CONT’D) (laughing) That’s right! Show him a good time, Dickie boy!

dialogues.speaker: ALEX AND NANCY
dialogues.text: Look to each other, befuddled.

dialogues.speaker: BACK UPSTAIRS
dialogues.text: Chick writhes with Mrs. Connelly on his head and Little Dickie on his crotch. He falls to his knees, and peels Mr Connelly off him. Mrs. Connelly falls to the ground, but goes into a roll a comes up back on her feet. Chick bats Little Dickie off him. Mrs. Connelly wipes a tiny bit of blood off her lip, Dick DeBruiser style. MRS. CONNELLY (CONT’D) (deadly calm) Nobody hits me bird. Chick starts to stand just Mrs. Connelly kicks him in the face. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 224 225 10/11/06 3rd Pink Revision 107. Chick staggers backwards into the Christmas Tree, which topples into the fire. The places erupts in flames.

dialogues.speaker: DOWNSTAIRS
dialogues.text: Nancy sees:

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: Smoke! Pouring through the hole in the ceiling.

dialogues.speaker: UPSTAIRS
dialogues.text: Chick is on his back, scared.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. CONNELLY
dialogues.text: Is lit from below by the flames of the fire. She has Chic knife. She tosses the knife from palm to palm.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. CONNELLY
dialogues.text: Now I’m going to peel your potatoes.

dialogues.speaker: CHICK
dialogues.text: Is shitting himself.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. CONNELLY
dialogues.text: Comes for him.

dialogues.speaker: THE RUG
dialogues.text: Is bunched up. She trips.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. CONNELLY
dialogues.text: Loses the knife and falls to the ground, hitting her head

dialogues.speaker: CHICK
dialogues.text: Beats a hasty retreat.

dialogues.speaker: A231
dialogues.text: 10/11/06 3rd Pink Revision 108.

dialogues.speaker: THE BROWNSTONE LOBBY 226
dialogues.text: Nancy and Alex run out of their apartment, just as... Chi comes bounding down the stairs... beaten bloodied... and now... for the first time... THEY SEE THE HARPOON IN HIS SHOULDER, still attached to t antique SPEAR-GUN which drags behind him. Without stopping, Chick runs by the couple, flying out th front door, inadvertently SMASHING THE DOOR-SIDE WINDOWS the harpoon as he exits. Nancy and Alex are stunned, wondering what the hell took place up there.

dialogues.speaker: UPSTAIRS
dialogues.text: They peek in her front door, see Mrs. Connelly lying unconscious -- the fire closing in on her. Little Dick squawks desperately. MOMENT OF TRUTH. Nancy and Alex look at the fire. At Mrs. Connelly. At Little Dick. Back at each other. AND THEY RUN OUT OF THE APARTMENT. We HOLD ON Mrs. Connelly for several LONG BEATS, the flam growing larger... until we:

dialogues.speaker: FOAM
dialogues.text: INT. MRS. CONNELLY’S APARTMENT - NIGHT 230 Nancy sprays a small extinguisher, trying to control the flames, heartbroken as she surveys the damage.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE STAIRCASE A231
dialogues.text: Nancy and Alex exit the apartment, Alex holding Mrs. Conn like a child. Nancy stops short...

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: Wait!

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: What?! She turns around, heads back into the burning apartment.  231 10/11/06 3rd Pink Revision 109.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex bursts out of the doorway, carrying the dazed Mrs. Connelly. The flames visible through the bay-window. A moment later, Nancy runs out of the building, her face black with smoke, CARRYING LITTLE DICKIE in her arms.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. CONNELLY
dialogues.text: Little Dickie?

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: Here you go. Little Dickie doesn’t move. Then he comes to life.

dialogues.speaker: LITTLE DICKIE
dialogues.text: Oh, boy! EXT. BROWNSTONE — NIGHT Fire trucks and police cars surround the place.

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER DAN
dialogues.text: I wouldn't have thought you had it in you...

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Yeah, well, we were just trying to help her out...

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: Her and Little Dickie...

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER DAN
dialogues.text: Well, I’1l just write you out a citation for the electricity...

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Thank you. Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It’s Spring. The sun shines brightly. Kids frolic in the Mommy and Me park. Alex and Nancy walk down the sidewalk, holding hands. Ale holds a thick manila envelope in his hand. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 10/11/06 3rd Pink Revision 110.

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: (calling) Kenneth! Kenneth waves to them from the front of the brownstone.

dialogues.speaker: A LITTLE LATER
dialogues.text: Alex and Nancy sign documents on a car hood.

dialogues.speaker: KENNETH
dialogues.text: Two more autographs, and that should do it. He slides one last document at them. KENNETH (CONT’D) So, how's the new place working out?

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: It’s cute.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: You think, “Hoboken,” but you hop on the train and in twelve minutes, you’re downtown...

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: Alex finished his novel!

dialogues.speaker: KENNETH
dialogues.text: Wonderful!

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: (gesturing with manila envelope) You might like this one. It’s sort of an urban thriller...

dialogues.speaker: KENNETH
dialogues.text: Ooh, I don’t like thrillers. Kenneth mock-shivers. Alex looks at him strangely. Just t A YOUNG COUPLE, the GUNTHERS, emerge from the building. T are played by CAMERON DIAZ and OWEN WILSON.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. GUNTHER
dialogues.text: You didn’t lie, Kenneth. It all looks wonderful. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 10/11/06 3rd Pink Revision 111.

dialogues.speaker: KENNETH
dialogues.text: Did I tell you they’d fix it up, or what? Gunthers, meet Alex and Nancy. They exchange ‘hello’s.’

dialogues.speaker: MR. GUNTHER
dialogues.text: We cannot thank you enough.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. GUNTHER
dialogues.text: This is just a dream house. It’s so quiet. Honey, won’t this be perfect for your sleep disorder?

dialogues.speaker: MR. GUNTHER
dialogues.text: I’m drowsy already. They all politely laugh.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Enjoy. Kenneth turns to Alex and Nancy.

dialogues.speaker: KENNETH
dialogues.text: Now, who wants to go and say hello to my favorite girl?

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: We should get going.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: (re: envelope) I promised to get this to my publisher today.

dialogues.speaker: KENNETH
dialogues.text: Nonsense. You saved the woman from a burning building. She’d be heartbroken if you left without saying goodbye. Kenneth grabs Nancy’s hand and starts to lead her up the stairs. Alex follows. He gets up a couple of steps, then thinks of something. He walks back down the steps and tal to Mr. Gunther.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Could you hold this for me? He hands Mr. Gunther the envelope, and bounds up the step where Nancy is holding open the door. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 10/11/06 3rd Pink Revision 112. Mr. Gunther looks at the envelope. Handwritten across the front in large block letters, it reads, “DUPLEX.” INT. MRS. CONNELLY’S APARTMENT - DAY Kenneth leads Nancy and Alex into the apartment. It’s bee perfectly redone. Little Dick sits on his perch. They slowly approach Mrs. Connelly.

dialogues.speaker: KENNETH
dialogues.text: Mrs. Connelly? I brought you a surprise! No response.

dialogues.speaker: KENNETH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (louder) Mrs. Connelly! Nancy and Alex smile knowingly.

dialogues.speaker: ON MRS. CONNELLY
dialogues.text: Her eyes are closed.

dialogues.speaker: KENNETH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (even louder) Dear-heart, wake up, I brought company. ON NANCY AND ALEX -- curious now. Kenneth leans over, gives Mrs. Connelly a light tap on th cheek.

dialogues.speaker: KENNETH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Mrs. Connelly? He shakes her a little harder.

dialogues.speaker: KENNETH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: She’s stiff as a board...

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: No, She’s just hard of hearing! Mrs. Connelly! Nancy CLAPS TWICE -- Mrs. Connelly remains frozen, but th turns on, Hawaii Five-O blasting through the speakers. Kenneth feels Mrs. Connelly’s pulse. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 10/11/06 3rd Pink Revision

dialogues.speaker: KENNETH
dialogues.text: (turns to Alex and Nancy) She's dead! Nancy and Alex look totally dumbfounded and fucked.

dialogues.speaker: A BEAT
dialogues.text: EXT. BROWNSTONE — DAY INT. MRS. CONNELLY’S APARTMENT - CONTINUOUS 113. ON KENNETH -- he sets the three places at the dining tabl

dialogues.speaker: KENNETH
dialogues.text: You had to see their faces when I said she was a goner. I swear, I thought they were gonna pass out right on the spot. WIDER -- we now see he’s talking to Officer Dan, dressed sweater and slacks -- he ties napkins into decorative kno

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER DAN
dialogues.text: Oh, sweetie, I wish I could’ve been there. A healthy looking Mrs. Connelly enters, setting down a casserole dish. They all sit around the table.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. CONNELLY
dialogues.text: Trust me, it wasn’t easy holding my breath all that time. Next time I want a bigger cut of your commission, Kenny.

dialogues.speaker: KENNETH
dialogues.text: What are you talking about? We give you everything, Ma. (puts his hand over Officer Dan’s) Danny and I barely have enough left over for a little cruise to the Carribean.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. CONNELLY
dialogues.text: I’m the one puttin’ my caboose on the line. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 10/11/06 3rd Pink Revision 114.

dialogues.speaker: KENNETH
dialogues.text: Come on, you had it easy with Alex and Nancy. And you’1l have the Friedman's out of here in a month. The husband’s got a sleep disorder.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. CONNELLY
dialogues.text: Oh, goodie.

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER DAN
dialogues.text: It can’t be any tougher than those last folks.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. CONNELLY
dialogues.text: Oh, they were a nice couple. Just a little bit over their heads. (vaising her glass) To Alan and Nancy.

dialogues.speaker: KENNETH
dialogues.text: Alan and Nancy... We freeze on the photo of Alex and Nancy. It’s the one Mr Connelly took of them when they tried to buy her out. The are in total shock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex and Nancy walk in shock down a quiet path that would normally be considered a beautiful place to take a stroll Spotting a bench, they sit down. The couple sit there silently for a beat. Nancy gets a sad look.

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: She was so full of life! Another beat. A bird chirps, a squirrel hops by. The city skyline can be seen behind them.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: You know, we had our differences, but that old lady was... (searching) ...Scrappy. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat. 10/11/06 3rd Pink Revision 115.

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: She taught us a lot. About ourselves.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: That when it comes right down to it, we’re not cold-blooded killers.

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: I feel pretty good about that.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Me, too.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I’m going to dedicate my book to Mrs. Connelly.

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: She did inspire you to write it. Nancy puts her hand on her stomach. A beat.

dialogues.speaker: NANCY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Do you think, maybe, we should name the baby after her?

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Maybe. Yeah, that would be... nice.

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: What’s her first name?

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: (realizing) I don’t know. Alex puts his arm around Nancy. They look up. We PULL OUT a beautiful cityscape. MUSIC: “He Moved Through the Fair” by Sinead O’Connor.

dialogues.speaker: A CHYRON SCROLLS UP THE SCREEN
dialogues.text: Alex's Novel, “My Favorite Upstairs Neighbor,” (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 10/11/06 3rd Pink Revision was published that summer. It sold poorly. However, Miramax bought the rights for a nice sum. They changed the title. That August, Nancy had a healthy, ten-pound baby boy. They named him Connelly. Mrs. Connelly lived another 62 years. 116.
